description:
This is the best breakfast place ever! Roberto & Jose made my omelette with a smile on their faces all week when I visited SF! Different every day, one better than the next.Their salsa is to die for! All staff very observant & friendly. The options of salads (many options an all very fresh) and other dishes to go is something I envy people how work or live near by Focacca! You need to go there and indulge. 
Lunch breaks in front of the computer can be a treat with a meal from Focaccca. 
I will be back.
author: Jenny H.

description:
Expensive....4.26 for a bagel and creme cheese.

It would be one thing if they were made in house or something  but even than? four bux? Just perpetuating the SF greed thing that is going on around here.

The people are friendly and all, but hey this just got stupid.
author: John C.

description: Focaccia is one of my go to lunch restaurants. It is split into 3 places to order your food, sandwiches, salad, and hot plate food. I've gotten a few of their sandwiches, the ingrediants were fresh and the weight of the sandwhich felt appropriate for the price. The salad section normally has a line durring lunch time. My favorite section is hot plate. The last few dishes I had were salmon baked salmon, Chile Colorado, and a half chicken.
author: Alex T.

description: I didn't care for this place very much. There's a small selection and their drinks do not even have sodas with real sugar instead of high-fructose corn syrup. That to me shows no interest in food quality for people that want to eat better. To top it off some Middle Eastern jackass yelled at me when I took a picture of the limited edition dr. Pepper cans and said no photos because I'm the owner. Well as far as I'm concerned this is nothing but a fancy-looking gas station like convenience store complete with the same jackass type of owner that has no respect for Americans.
author: Greg D.

description: Despite the incremental price increases over the years, this is still one of my go-to salad spots. Recently, their build-your-own salads have the option to add a grain (couscous, farro, quinoa), for no additional cost! This is an AWESOME add-on to fill up your belly. I also enjoy their breakfast burritos (enormous) and their rotisserie chicken. Salad line gets long during lunch so come around 11 to 11:30am!
author: Vickie Z.

description:
I had the Poke Bowl today, and it is the BOMB!  Super good and super healthy!  One of the best Poke Bowl's ever!  
All of their salads are really good.  Going back for more next week!
author: Mark H.

description: This place is located right next to my office at 425 Market St. I sometimes start early mornings and I am always warmly welcomed by the staff. They are always cheerful and make me feel welcomed into the establishment. I love their bagels with cream cheese and salmon. And I've never had a bad item or a regret purchasing something from here.  I'm so happy that I have a place like this close by to my work. I hope they stay open because it's hard to find a genuinely pleasant place like this anymore.
author: Robert C.

description: If it wasn't for the fact that I like the coffee there, I wouldn't go into this place.  The cashier is the most unfriendly person I've ever met.  She doesn't care to say good morning or make you feel welcomed, not even a smile.  This morning, I went in to get my coffee, and she saw me going towards the coffee dispenser and yet she went ahead of me to get herself a coffee when what she should have done is to allow the customer, me (!) to get it first!  How impolite!  I'm in the service industry, and if I see a customer coming in to get her coffee, I will certainly let her get hers first!  One of my coworkers went in and got his food and went to her to pay for it, and she told him, it's not 6:30am yet, you have to wait 2 minutes.  He never went back.  I want to say though, the middle eastern guy, who seems to be the owner or manager, is very nice, always saying good morning.  Maybe he can teach the cashier about good customer service and good manners! Having a smile won't hurt business either!  I lov the breakfast there too, and the cooks are very nice, too bad the cashier is so unfriendly!  I may look for another coffee/breakfast place since I don't want to see someone who's so unfriendly, and I don't need that in the mornings!
author: Alice L.

description:
I usually try to drag my friends to this place every-week, reason i love their chicken.

They have really cool deals on the menu, you can get a 1/2 chicken for 12.95$ plus two sides and a 1/4 chicken for 8.95$ plus two sides. 

During peak times their salad section is really crowded though!
author: Vipul S.

description: Health code violation which explains the food poising I had a few weeks ago.  Stay away. Much better options in downtown.
author: Keith L.

description: Awful, spoiled, and overpriced 'food' and a shut down for health code violations.  Stay away.
author: Jon N.

description:
Was walking through FiDi/SOMA last week around lunchtime and had a craving for a salad or something healthy. Naturally, I opened the Yelp App (shameless plug), found Focaccia Market was right next to me and thought, welp let's give it a shot. Apparently this place gets pretty long lines but, that wasn't my experience when I was there. 

I'll be the first to admit, I was really confused with the "make your own" salad menu. It's not very clear but, there are tons of options you can add to your salad so props to that. The woman helping me out was super nice and friendly and walked me through the process with ease. Pheeeew. :) 

I ordered the mixed greens and added a few different things (not important) and added chicken. The next thing I noticed was how huge the salad was! It's actually a really good deal and next time I come back I'm totally just getting the regular size. Look, the salad was pretty good, not mindblowing, but fine. The reason for 3 stars, not 4 was the quality of chicken. These days you have to have quality proteins and the chicken was clearly low quality meat. I was actually kind of surprised because they serve "Boars Head" brand meats at their deli counter. Maybe they should just use those instead...

If you're on a budget and want a sizable lunch, I'd say stop by for a visit. Just make sure you're not getting any chicken on the salad :)
author: Benjamin F.

description:
It's disturbing how you make it sound like closing was your own choice when the health department revoked your license to operate. Please try and be more honest with your customers. Personally, will not be eating there again. 
Read the health department site, people: Vermin Infestation.
author: r a.

description:
4.5 STARS

Before I started working in the Financial District, I've heard a lot of stories about having to spend too much money on breakfast that will break my pocket. Now that I'm in the area, you have no idea how glad I am to have Focaccia that's literally 1 block away from my office. 

This review is mainly for their BREAKFAST selection. I am in love with it. They serve everything I like with a affordable price such like eggs, omelet, bagels, oatmeal, fruit yogurt, and salads. The owner is super chill too!

I'll be back.
author: Danny L.

description:
I went to Focaccia to grab breakfast before heading to work. Knowing I'm going to pay an arm and a leg for something that I could have and should have made at home, I still needed food to eat.

There's not a lot of options open around 6am in the morning, so it was nice that they were up and running.

I ordered a simple egg wrap with broccoli and mushrooms (trying to be healthy here). The quality of the food looks fresh so that's a plus. And it's all made to order...another plus. 

I got my food, said the respective thank you to the guy that made my food and sadly gave my card to the cashier to pay for the wrap.

At my office, I take my first couple bites of the wrap. It's nice and warm and simple. Again nothing too crazy since every addition topping costs between .49-1.99 more...then I hit the third of the wrap...and CRUNCHHHH...eggshells.

I'm not talking a tiny little thing, I'm talking about half of the freaking egg shell. I mean maybe it's a good source of calcium but it was definitely not what I was expecting...

So there goes $8.29 down the drain as I sneak out of the main office to hide and spit out the remnants of the eggshell in my mouth.

Note to self: bring your own breakfast from now on.
author: Lea C.

description:
My favorite rotisserie chicken. I love that I can come and get something from the hot foods section quickly when there's a long line for salads. 

For their salads I love getting the spicy chicken and the prices are reasonable for the FiDi. My go to lunch spot!
author: Daniela J.

description: Focaccia is definitely a go to breakfast and lunch destination for me. I love their fresh options and diverse menu. As a vegetarian, there are an immense variety of DELICIOUS salads and sandwiches and other menu items, I've made so many different combinations I never get tired of coming back. And to top it all off, the family owned and operated atmosphere of Focaccia at this location is the cherry on top of the Focaccia experience!
author: Hilary E.

description:
As a focaccia lover, I just had to check out this place. It's a cute little spot sandwiched between 3rd and 4th St in the China Basin. I still have sandwiches on the brain after putting together a delicious concoction for lunch today: roast beef and brie melted on focaccia with a pesto spread, onions, sprouts and tomatoes. Yum!

The sandwich itself is the perfect portion and made with very fresh ingredients. I forgot to ask for salt and pepper which would have enhanced the flavor, but I was pretty happy with the sandwich overall. I knew the portion would fill me up quickly, so I skipped the baked goods and coffee drinks. Looking forward to trying them on the next run, along with a salad!
author: Yasmin S.

description:
Love building my own salad. First 3 toppings not including seafood or meat is only $6.45 and a large is $8.45. So many choices and additional topping is only 60 cent. Meat for the small salad is about $2.50 I believe. The salads are huge. So yummy and so many dressings to choose from as well. The lines are kinda long but goes buy quickly. Tip, you can mix your choice of veggie. I normally mixed mine with romaine and arugula. YUM!

Also FREE bread on your way out.
author: Sandy B.

description:
I've always liked the food at this place. And 90% of the staff is great. But I had to stop going there after being abused by the surly bagel lady one too many times. First my bagel got stuck in the toaster and got burned but she wanted to serve it to me anyway. When I asked her to make me a new one, she had a temper tantrum and then turned the machine up to the fastest setting so that my bagel was barely warm when it came out. She really got upset when I asked her to run it though again. A decent employee would have recognized that the first bagel was ruined and just started over without causing a lot of drama. But not this lady. She made sure that everyone knew how out of line I was for not wanting to pay for or eat a blackened bagel.

Future visits didn't improve, despite telling management exactly what was going on. Apparently this woman is complained about regularly by both patrons and coworkers but nothing is done because she's pregnant. She has no business being in a customer-facing position and should either be moved to food prep in the back or terminated. I hate to give up on a business because of one terrible employee but after talking to management about it three times I gave up. The last thing that I need is to start the day dealing with misery.
author: Jennifer R.

description:
For our weekly catered office lunch on Friday, December 4th, we ordered food from Focaccia Market & Bakery. Everyone basically chose a lunch box.

I ended up getting a Specialty salad box ($14.95). Decided on the Seafood salad box (+$1): grilled salmon, chopped romaine lettuce, edamame, tomatoes, cucumbers and lime vinaigrette dressing with Fruit salad, Cookies. I wasn't sure if I was going to like the food here as their selection seemed kind of boring. I was pleasantly surprised. The salad was super fresh and a hefty portion. I adored the refreshing lime dressing and the salmon wasn't overcooked. I did note in my order that I wanted the salmon medium, so I wasn't sure how much that attributed to the cooking of the salmon. The fruit salad was disappointing as the watermelon was mushy and a piece looked kind of moldy. I ended up throwing it away. I didn't try the cookie as I don't really like chocolate. The box also came with a piece of focaccia bread.

It's fun when a place exceeds my expectations. I was completely ready to not like my lunch. Great place for fresh salads!
author: Elena N.

description: The food is well made here.  In the mornings, breakfast is made-to-order.  The line can get long so get in here early.  I always get the breakfast croissant sandwich with eggs, cheese and bacon.  SO YUMMY.  During lunch, the line is ridiculous!  But the food is fresh and ingredients are top quality.  Total comfort food.  Highly recommend and the people here work extremely hard to serve you.  Don't forget to tip!
author: Jill P.

description: I only come here for the salads, and it's probably my favorite salad bar in the Financial District. For the amount of salad you get in a small size (which is kind of a lot!), you get your money's worth. The first 3 toppings you add are free and the fourth one onward costs extra. My only complaint is that the employees don't really keep track of how many toppings they add to your salad, so sometimes you add more than 3 unknowingly. I'm also unsure of how clean this place is because the employee at the end will toss your salad and place it in a plastic container, but will wipe your container with a dirty cloth used for the table and everyone else's salad order. I try to look past it, however. Also, make sure to grab your free focaccia by the register!
author: Christal C.

description: There aren't many places in San Francisco where you can get a delicious, healthy and fresh lunch for $8. The staff and management of friendly and salads and sandwiches are made right in front of you. Definitely my go-to spot in San Francisco for lunch.
author: Tyler H.

description:
I recently used Focaccia to cater a weekend-long event for about 200 people and they did a fantastic job.  From providing samples of their catering options and working out menus to visiting our site ahead of time and setting up by 6 AM on a Saturday morning, they expertly handled every aspect of the catering for our event.   

The food was fresh, plentiful and served hot and Yee and his on-site staff were very professional and on top of everything.  I truly didn't have to worry about a single aspect of meal service for our guests.  

We will definitely use them again for future events!
author: Rebecca W.

description:
Before working in FIDI I heard of the overwhelmingly number of lunch spots that serve salad at extreme prices. Now that I'm in the area, you don't know how glad I am to have Focaccia at my reach.

A small salad is 6.95 and comes with your choice of greens, 3 toppings, and choice of dressing.  You can also add croutons as well (not an additional topping!) My go to is Romaine+Mixed greens with Garbanzo beans, corn, and mozzarella cheese topped with light caesar dressing. I've never seen mozzarella as a option for cheese before and am so glad to have tried it. LOVE IT! After you pay, you also get to select from a slice of honey oat or white bread on the side. All of this is sure to fill you up for lunch and then some. 

I love this place - its definitely my go to for lunch.

I recommend going before 12 as the line can get long for lunch. I also went at the end of lunch before (almost 2) and noticed by that time a lot of their ingredients are gone. Meat is extra and there is also an option to get a Large sized salad
author: Michelle C.

description:
A stuffed small salad for only $7?! This is such a good deal! The one thing I love about the salads here is the fresh mozerella. It's delicous! The small salad comes with 3 toppings, and although 3 toppings doesn't sound like a lot the salad is delcicious and I think a big part of the reason why is because of the fresh mozerella. 

I would stay away from adding the tuna salad because although the tuna salad was good, they put way too much which made my salad really soggy. 

I got my small salad with grilled salmon once and it came with lots of salmon, way more salmon than needed for that size of a salad so it kind of threw the proportion of salad to salmon off. But I'm not complanning! 

The salad also comes with a slice of bread that you can pick up at the register after you pay.
author: Michelle T.

description: It's ok, but I usually end up here when boss from out of town comes and have to come up with a place fast.  And I always wish I had chosen another spot.  The special with the roast chicken is ok, but not nearly as good as other places and I'm not that big on the sides.  Also, seem like I must get the wheat focaccia which isn't that great.  I've had the salad a few times and serviceable.  In all, it will do, but won't excite you too much.  No seating, but once that get that plaza back open, lots of great outdoor spots to eat around.
author: Marc S.

description: Don't mess up the pronunciation! I needed a quick breakfast and Focaccia [foe--cot--tcha] was in the Morrison Foerster building, my final destination. Perfect. I ordered a mixed fruit bowl to share (approx $5) and a scrambled egg sandwich with cheese on croissant roll (approx $4).  While I was waiting in line to order, I got to watch one of the employees cut fresh focaccia from a large freshly baked pan and put the cut squares in individual paper bags for sale. They sort of looked like cornbread, and as they were lined up at the register as an add-on purchase, I have a feeling they were very reasonably priced. The Focaccia space is clean, well-lit and quite open and airy since there are no places to sit inside. I chose a small cafe table outside to eat my breakfast, and although it was chilly outside I enjoyed my food, it was a great start to the day.
author: Elizabeth V.

description: I've never had a bad lunch from Focaccia, but I'm docking one star because they are a bit overpriced and given the poor health rating they received a month or two back, they were only able to raise it up to 71!!!! Just shows poor management. Given their previous rating was in the 50s or 60s, I'd think they would've cleaned house (so-to-speak). 71 is still piss-poor imo. Anyway, food is good.
author: Daniel F.

description: Way Overpriced. For two scrambled eggs I got charged for a full sandwich.
author: Shruti D.

description:
Solid lunch spot. The line is usually pretty long around lunch time so you you can expect to wait a bit, but they aren't stingy with their salad ingredients.

I bought a small salad with added chicken for $9.70 and was pretty satisfied with it.
author: Claudia S.

description:
Like almost everyone else who works in the FiDi area, I also come here on a regular basis to get a salad for lunch. I love make-your-own option places!

My go-to salad choices: 

1) Mixed greens + spinach + cucumbers + edamame + red bell pepper + hint of salt & pepper + light soy dressing = an Asian inspired salad.

2) Mixed greens + spinach + beets + goat cheese + cucumbers + light raspberry dressing = a fresh salad with just a bit of rich creaminess.

Optional: adding free croutons and grabbing some fresh focaccia or honey wheat bread the door.

The service here is as efficient as they can be during busy lunch rushes. I've only come to the salad bar, but they typically have about 5 people putting your salads together and a couple people as designated "salad mixers." However, I do notice that some workers like to pack your boxes with veggies while others are less generous. 

Other things to note:
- Come before 11:30am or after 1:00pm to avoid the major lunch rush
- They close after 2:00pm and will be out of popular veggies if you come late
- Croutons are a free topping!

I'm a fan of Focaccia offering both small and large salad options with a huge variety of fresh veggies and toppings. I'll keep coming here for lunch as long as I work in the area!
author: Bonnie Z.

description: I recommend Foccacia to anyone who likes high quality, fresh food, made to order and served by smiling faces.  I eat here frequently and have never been disappointed by selections from the sandwich bar or the salad bar.  The special entrees also look great, but I haven't tried them (yet).  I particularly enjoy the staff as they are always ready with a smile of recognition and a little playful banter.  Great vibe!
author: Kent B.

description: First time going to focaccia, and unfortunately found a critter in my salad :/ also believe they were recently closed for health violations, so definitely will not be returning.
author: Mia K.

description:
Reasonable prices
9 sandwich that you build , very good
Cookies were ok
Ok lines at lunch
Almond croissant and blueberry scones in the morning were good
author: Jones T.

description: Walked by a few times and was intimidated by the long lunch lines. There are 3 separate lines for sandwiches, salads, and hot foods. Once you get your food, you bring it to the registers (another separate line). The salad line always seems the longest. You can customize what goes into your sandwich or salad. I've tried the sandwiches twice and it's pretty good! Clean, healthy, and ~$10. Sandwiches aren't huge but they are pretty filling. My coworkers get the salads and the portions are pretty big!
author: Bing L.

description:
Poor quality food prep and terrible customer service. 

If you're thinking of catering from here, imagine taking a bite of a breakfast burrito or scramble...and crunching down on eggshells. So disgusting. 

We catered breakfast for my company from here, and we found eggshells in our dishes on 3 separate occasions. The first time, I thought it was a fluke. The second time, I told Focaccia management, and they promised it wouldn't happen again. After the third time, I'm never ordering from here again.

The management here is also very unprofessional. I had to call and email several times before I could get any response. When I finally did get in touch, management was very apologetic but still didn't fix the problem. Egg shell again a few weeks ago,  I wrote the same manager and he didn't bother replying.

We love the taste of the food here, but we'll never order again because the preparation is obviously very poor and management can't do anything about it. Thankfully, there are plenty of other options for breakfast that deliver in the area.
author: Mel D.

description:
You can get a half grilled chicken here for $7. And add 2 more sides for about $4-5 more. That's a good deal considering their portions are huge! An order like that was big enough to give me lunch for 2 days in a row! Their grilled chicken is super yummy and flavorful. I love the spices on the skin.. 

I saw that the line for the salad bar was crazy long, but you can make your own salad and the portions are also really big for a salad too. I'll have to try that or a sandwich next time! But there will definitely be a next time cuz their food is yummy and price is reasonable.
author: Jenn N.

description: BEST SALAD BAR EVER. I love it here it's the perfect breakfast and lunch. I always grab a yogurt to go and a salad and seriously it's the best ever!!!
author: Kelly T.

description: A great spot for a fresh salad, and plenty of healthy options. Tried the breakfast burrito last time and it was excellent!
author: Faisal Q.

description:
BREAKFAST GRABS!! 
(4 stars) 

I love convenience and good bites to grab. 

-FOOD, good
-PRICES, depends 
-SERVICE, really good
-AMBIANCE, cafe/market no place to sit 

Glad this is just steps away from the office. Workaholics usually don't leave the building, we have it made upstairs!!! But there's a time or two I crave a hot breakfast item I don't eat everyday. 

HEFER STATS. 

LOX AND BAGEL ($6.95) - toasted bagel of choice, lox, cream cheese, and capers. It's definitely better then Noah's bagels. But their bagels do harden after awhile like Noah's bagels. What I like here, you watch them make your breakfast on the spot and you can control how much or how little you want of something. Just like their omelette line! 

HASH-BROWNS (only) - sometimes when I just want one side only, it's always expensive. Here, they gave me a lot of hash browns in a box for only $1!!! So awesome!!!! 

PASTRY/CHOCOLATE MUFFIN BROWNY ($3) - honestly, I don't know what it's called but it looked just as that. Dense, crunchy ends, and very chocolatey. 

Will I Be back? Yes. Is like to try other breakfast items. 

Until the next review....
author: Jane A.

description: This is my staple with I worked in Fi-Di. You just can't go wrong with a good salad.
author: Connie X.

description:
There are just too many better options with attitude-free service compared to Focaccia. While Mixt Greens is slightly more expensive, it is far superior service as the staff at Focaccia (particularly the salad service) is often rushed and overwhelmed. Recently I received an incorrect order (multiple mistakes for a single salad): the size was wrong, the ingredients were wrong, but the attitude from the female manager was simply a deal-breaker for ever going back there again. 

I understand that mistakes are made, but the follow-up service and conversation makes me wonder if the manager used to work for the Post Office, because that's the only other place I've seen give such bad attitude to customers. 

After waiting for nearly 20 minutes and ordering a small cobb salad - I received a large for like $15. I was then told that's not how I was supposed to order... instead, I need to say ingredient-by-ingredient. LOL Ummm... okay! Clearly my fault. Like I said, there are just too many better options in the area.
author: PJ J.

description:
I just noticed this bakery/market on my way to a clients home, and stopped in to see what they had. There's a large selections of salads that you can custom make, sandwiches on fresh focaccia bread and hot bar items, in addition to baked goods and drinks. While it is a bit on the pricier side, I've come to expect this from downtown and but has healthier options for the price. 

The cheese pastry is really delicious and i found my salad to be very fresh and filling (i had a large) which does come with your choice of white or whole wheat focaccia bread. 

Tip: unless you work down here, i suggest avoiding the rush hour between 11:30-1pm.
author: Petra S.

description: In love with their veggie sandwiches.Delicious,fresh and wholesome!
author: Fauzia S.

description:
This food is such great quality. I usually go before or after the lunch hour as it gets a little packed but they're pretty organized and the wait isn't too bad even then. I tend to get the small salad as once there is chicken and veggies added it is quite a good meal size. Large you can probably split with a friend. And they give you complimentary focaccia bread, white or wheat with butter on the side if you so choose when you pay. 

The reason I'm writing this review is that I had a breakfast wrap from this place, 4 egg, tomato, sausage, veggie and it was spectacular, reminded me of how my mom would make me a meal. The cooks know what they're doing and you can't really go wrong with whatever you get. 

Yes, it is a bit pricey but it's San Francisco, basically Financial District...Everything is pricey.
author: Gabriel O.

description: Snack selection could be better but there are just enough healthy options. Good lunch go-to.
author: K. W.

description:
I love this place for a weekday lunch. I haven't yet tried their to-go boxed meals, or soups yet but their sandwiches are to die for. 

Their bread(s) is amazingly soft and fresh. I crave it all the time!

My go to is

1. Pesto spread
2. Toasted Wheat Focaccia 
3. Cheddar cheese
4. Tomatoes
5. Avacado
6. Cucumbers
7. Greens
8. Roasted Red Peppers

I tried their salad for the first time pretty recently. It's $8.45 for a large salad which may be a good lunch size if that's all you are eating. $8.45 comes with the base greens, 3 toppings and 1 dressing and a side of focaccia bread. Meats, cheeses, seafood, etc. is additional. I asked for it to be tossed. 

1. Baby spinach (they put a lot of spinach and not enough of the toppings in my opinion)
2. Cucumbers
3. Cherry tomatoes
4. Garbanzo Beans
5. Sesame Soy Dressing (I loved this dressing! One of my favorites)

They ask you if you want salt/pepper and the amount of dressing (light/medium/heavy). I went with Medium and it was perfect.
author: Hiral P.

description:
Never stepped in here before but a work partner bought my team and I lunch. Currently eating the Turkey Sandwich and it is GOOD! We had it delivered so its a box lunch (comes with a cookie and a bag of chips). The box itself is pretty useful. 

All in all, the turkey sandwich gets a thumbs up from me.
author: A o S.

description:
I've been going to Focaccia on a regular basis for 5 years now.  Breakfast, lunch, or picking up food to go (yummy rotisserie chicken) before I head home for work.  Breakfast - I tend to go for croissant sandwiches, bacon, fruit, oatmeal, etc; Lunch - I order salads (way earlier than noon so I don't hit the line) for my work lunches; Dinner - I order salads and take them home for my dinner; Other Occasions - anytime that I'm going to a potluck meal, I always try to sign up for a salad because I know I can go to Focaccia and pay a great price for a great salad and not cut a single vegetable!  
I would love to make food at home but I don't have time to prep and I can get 8 toppings for cheap compared to other salad places in the city so I feel like I'm getting a great deal.  The salad bar choices are fantastic, the prices are reasonable, the service is always with a smile.  I'm eating a club sandwich as we speak and it's fresh and made hot.  Did I mention that there's also pre-made food so you don't have to wait in any line unless you want to customize your meal?  And let's not forget the AMAZING focaccia bread you get free with your meal.  It's twice as big as any other piece of focaccia you'll find downtown, I bet.

I've never experienced any food that was spoiled or not super fresh and I've never felt sick in the slightest.    I hesitate to write this review because I don't want this popular place to get even more popular but I hate to see the other reviewers putting down what I think of as my "go-to" lunch spot.
author: Corinne W.

description:
When I need a protein-packed kind-of-paleo lunch that isn't a salad, I come to Focaccia and laugh at all the people in the ridiculously long salad and sandwich line. I mostly come here for the hot meal, which has its own line (or rather, no line at all!). The hot meal consist of the entree and 2 sides for anywhere between $12 - $15. I've had the Coq au Vin (which was a bit dry and the sauce didn't provide much additional flavor) and the Tri Tip, which actually came out pretty tasty and not over cooked. The entree specials change daily which is great because I'd get so sick of eating their roasted chicken day after day. 

The available sides look like they've been pre-cooked hours earlier (especially the grilled veggies which I'm prone to getting), but at least there's a little variety. 

I really do wonder what's with this city's obsession with standing in line for salad.
author: Virginia T.

description:
I'm having to downgrade this place a bit due to the cost / what they deliver. Too often I'm left thinking that while the item purchased was 'ok', it wasn't worth the $. For example, just got an egg-sandwich after having not used their service for awhile and low and behold, lots of fun egg shells are in the sandwich. Really? Not good for that price.

My tip: stick with a basic salad, as that is the only 'value' left there.
author: Jonathan H.

description:
I've been working in the SOMA for more than a year now and I've gone to most of the eateries within a two block radius.  Focaccia  was one of those places that  wasn't on a walking route to my work or conveniently near any regular place that I go to lunch.  

One day, I did take a special trip to come here for lunch and I was quite surprised at how orderly and organized they arranged the internal layout of their business.  The sandwiches had one line, the salads had another line, and then the hot entrees were another line.  I lined up in the salads line and it was a pretty long line, even longer than the Tender Greens line one block away.  Long lines usually are no big deal as long as they are turning over salads super fast.  On that day, it wasn't as quick as I hoped it to be.

Their salad system is build your own style so three ingredients plus protein and other fancy extras are extra.  They have a small size and large size salad option, just like Pluto's.  Just for research purposes, I ordered the large salad with chicken and avocado.  The total came out to a bit over $12 but it was a big salad.  This can easily be shared by two people.  Since I don't like sharing my lunch, I ate half of it at lunch and then the rest a few hours later.

My salad came with focaccia bread which is way better than some of the nasty bread sides that I've gotten at other lunch places.  The prices here are more expensive than Pluto's but around the Tender Greens/Mixt Greens level.  I probably will try a sandwich here in the future but the salads were a bit pricy for my taste.
author: Ben H L.

description:
I have been here probably close to 100 times for lunch.  It is great to be able to get a salad for less than $10 in SF at lunchtime and this place delivers for about $7.00 (for small salad that is big enough).  The food is fresh and delicious and custom-made.  I like my salads with a mixed greens and arugala for some kick, three veggies, some nuts, and a light salad dressing.  

Don't forget to pick up a slice of the focaccia bread next to the cashier that is included in the price of the salad.

Yes, the lines are crazy-long at lunch time, but what popular place in SF isn't?
author: Bob F.

description: I tried this bakery for 1st time. I ordered their special "steak salad". This place is a build your own salad. You have to choose 4 toppings and the dressing. Salad tasted like average and the price was expensive almost $16 plus tax.
author: Mila N.

description:
This place gets extra crazy around lunchtime, but given the location, it totally makes sense. I ordered a half sandwich of smoked turkey and avocado on focaccia. It was a pretty plain sandwich, but I was in an all day conference, so I didn't want to eat anything too strong. They have tons of fixing selections for sandwiches and salads, as well as hot options. 

My sandwich was good, but it was the service that really earns these stars. The sandwich guys were all super friendly, very fast and efficient. Prices were reasonable for the size and meat portion you get.
author: Mel L.

description:
i've never really wanted to try Focaccia even though it's around the block from my work. there's always a long line but coworkers wanted this so i got their toasted salami sandwich (i normally get the Italian sandwiches). they give a good amount of meat but it was only ok. i most likely won't vote to come back here. although i heard people liking their salads, but salad is just a salad. 

honestly not sure how the pricing of this works. there's no marker or any sticker receipt on the sandwich when you order.
author: Sherry Y.

description:
This review is mostly based only on a quick takeout for a scone. I'm new to the area so I'm getting a feel for SF. I got the cranberry scone and eating it right now on my work desk. It is delicious! Perfectly textured to be dry and harder on the outside and softer less dry on the inside. Most scones you'd buy at the national chain coffee shops are dry both in and out of the scone. This scone from Focaccia doesn't even need to be dipped in my coffee. I had a bagel with regular cream cheese last week and that was delicious also. Price for the delicious scone was 2.95 (not bad). I can't remember what I paid for the bagel with cream cheese but I do remember it being remarkably cheaper than what I used to pay for in LA.

As for the place itself. Very modern inside. If you want a bagel with a spread, there is one line and the other has a more prepared breakfast sandwich. For quick takeout (e.g. scones, muffins, boxed lunches, etc), they are on the opposite side of the market. The staff is very nice and cordial, even with the long lines and the types of folks that hate being up to early. They understand it, and roll with it. 

I'll have to try lunch one day.
author: John M.

description:
Ordered the half Roma panini w/ side salad (caesar)

Sooo good!  I've always wanted a panini maker and this just reaffirms my love for paninis.  Everything was fresh.  Although it was just half a sandwich, it was huge.  And if that doesn't fill you up, the salad will.

Will definitely come back =)
author: Linda N.

description: I come here frequently for the breakfast. They have an amazing omelette station and the chef is super sweet and accommodating. He makes it exactly the way you want. I have tried the bagels and oatmeals, they are good too.
author: Aditi S.

description:
The weekday lunch line can be daunting, but it actually goes pretty fast. The salad here is very fresh and affordable! 

I would just go for the mix green with a few toppings, it is delicious, and now I have developed a weekly routine to come here for a vegetarian lunch. Plus  they have a staff who looks like  Zoe Barnes from House of cards.

Overall a solid place for reasonably priced salad.
author: Cheng C.

description:
This review is for their catering. 
I've enjoyed food from Focaccia in the past, so thought I'd order from them for a corporate event. Their delivery was 25 minutes late. I called in to double check on the status of the order when it was 15 minutes past the delivery time and was placed on hold because the phone rep said there was another catering order inquiry. Knowing that my order was not the only one late was not of solace- this shows they're consistently late.
author: Sasha S.

description:
Nothing mind-blowingly awesome about Focaccia, but it's the type of place I can appreciate for what it is. Yes there are long lines, yes the ordering can be somewhat stressful, but there is much to love about this typical neighborhood lunch spot:

+ long lines that move quickly thanks to hard-working staff
+ variety of salad and sandwich options, the number of salads you could create is really endless
+ fresh ingredients + huge portions and fair prices
+ clean space

If I could offer up one piece of advice - take them up on the "light" dressing when they ask. If having the dressing mixed in, you'll have the option of light, medium, or heavy. I opted for medium my first time and my pour salad turned into a soupy mess. Rookie mistake!
author: Brianna M.

description:
It's noon. You have a half-hour before your next meeting, the one your colleague scheduled because he claimed he couldn't find any other convenient time slot. Convenient for him, he should have said. What to do. I didn't have a muffin this morning. So Focaccia has become my emergency grab-n-go spot for a salad or a sandwich. It's a more reasonably priced alternative to Mixt Greens and without the claustrophobia factor of those endless lines. The expansive space helps as do the explicit directions on how they assemble their food.

You know the drill. You pick among four types of lettuces, then you need to pick three of the multitude of toppings that they offer. Decide before you get to the preparer because you're holding me up. I'll be late for my meeting. Tick-tock, tick-tock. I have a thing for beets and hearts of palm, so I just need to decide on a third... cucumbers for the crunch. You then decide on your dressing. There are nine. Hurry up! The salad up to this point costs $7.25 for a large bowl (see photo) or $5.25 for a small. Additional toppings cost 75-cents per on a large and 50-cents per on a small.

It also adds up if you add meat or seafood or avocados. At that point, you should probably be making a reservation at the Pig Trough. I made that up, but don't tell me you didn't get at least a little excited at the idea of a Pig Trough. OK, go wait in another line for the register and pick up your bag of bread. Run back to the office 'cause you're five minutes late now. A good-enough salad. Nothing to distract me from the meeting. On another trip, I tried a Roast Beef Sandwich for the price, $7.25 (see photo). It works the same way. Gotta go.

FOOD - 3 stars...decent salads and sandwiches in a hurry
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...a big, bright place with organized lines...what more do you want?
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...they have their routine down pat
TOTAL -3 stars...I'd rather mix greens here vs. the pricier Mixt Greens
author: Ed U.

description:
The choose-your-own salads are a great deal. They're plenty filling (even the small size one), tasty and reasonably priced (~$6). While there can be a long line at lunch, it does move quickly since they have 3-4 people working behind the salad bar counter. 

Here's some salad ordering tips:

1) When it's your turn, move to a position in front of salad maker so you can hear each other. It can get noisy in there.
2) Choose your base leafery (arugula, mixed, baby spinach, kale, etc)
3) Choose your toppings. 3 are included, and meat costs extra. 
4) Choose your dressing. They will also also ask light, medium, heavy. IMO, light tends to be enough.
5) (Optional) Choose specialized toppings. There are some additional toppings (croutons, nuts, sunflowers seeds, etc.)  on the sides of the salad bar. These are not listed on the blackboard.
6) (Optional) There's complimentary focaccia bread in both white/wheat forms next to salad counter. Unfortunately, it's greasy and spongy and just unappetizing. Yes, I just recommended skipping focaccia bread at a place called 'Focaccia'.

What about the other stuff?

They offer sandwiches. They're a step above Subways, but not my favorites. You can get them toasted as well.

They also have a rotating menu for the hot meal entrees (with customizable sides). It feels like old school cafeteria type food and can be bland, but I always check it out. I've had some unexpectedly good food. You'll probably have leftovers as well.

ProTip: There's a soup line to right side of salad bar, so you can skip the salad line and order some soup directly. Their soups are pretty good most days.

ProTip #2: Cookies at payment counter are tasty.
author: Pedrum M.

description: LOVE the fresh tossed salads! The line gets crazy at lunch time, but I've never had a bad salad here! Sandwiches are decent also if you're in a hurry.
author: J B.

description:
I'm trying this new diet, "No Carbs" and this place really helps.

This place has a huge variety to choose from that make anyone feel satisfied. But I don't know how I feel about a basic 3 toping salad for $10. Taste awesome! I guess you pay for what you get.
author: Pj A.

description:
Quick Review:  My go to for salad in SOMA but I also love the made to order breakfast on occasion.  If you are looking for a healthy lunch option, this is a great place for fresh salad and yummy fixins but it's on you to choose wisely.  You get 3 free toppings in your salad and then charged per topping, which can get pricey depending on what you order.  They are also serve hot food, the Mac and Cheese is sooo good.  Be prepared for a long wait, you definitely have to time your arrival. 

FOOD
Its mainly a salad spot because everything is so fresh.  The line is sometimes 20 minutes because its so popular.  They have whole eggs that they smash to order or egg whites.  There is also a protein option you can add.  I have also had the sandwiches, I love the fact that you can get it toasted.  They have really good cheese options, my favorite is the gouda.  There is a variety of meat options as well, not your typical processed stuff but REAL meat.  The hot food station typically varies by day but consistently there is rotisserie chicken.  Breakfast - fresh omelets (does not use egg beater), potatoes, oatmeal, breakfast sandwiches (croissant, bagels).  Everything comes with free focaccia bread, hence the name lol.  Also good portions regardless of it being lunch, breakfast, sandwich or hot food! 

CUSTOMER SERVICE
Despite the long lines they are pretty fast considering how much traffic they get each day.  Some pack on the dressing compared to others, I don't like my salad drenched so I always say "light dressing" just in case.  For the most part super nice and friendly staff.  

Definitely recommend!
author: Brittany S.

description:
Build your own salad is the best approach to eating salads.I loved getting to add all of the toppings I want while leaving my least favorite out. I also liked getting a piece of bread while I paid.

The lines are quite long so get there early!
author: Briceyda L.

description:
Was introduced to Foccacia by a coworker and I love coming here for lunch. There's a section for cooked foods, sandwiches and a salad bar. The salad bar usually has the longest line but basically you go up and "make your own salad". There is a wide array of toppings you can choose from as well as dressing and veggies, etc. 

This place is super worth it because for even a small salad they load it with sooo much stuff. They basically stuff it to the fullest AND it's decently priced. 

I've also tried their mac and cheese which was super bomb as well.
author: Krystal O.

description:
Foccacia is just next to my bldg it's probably the closest food spot yet I've find here twice in the last year and a half. I might be the small percentage that isn't in love with this place. It def has strong customer loyalty because the lunch lines are always pretty hefty! It sounds like people love it.

I find it more hyped up and trendy and sort of average in food yet pretty pricy. People wait in really long lines for their own mix-in salads but I find them pretty lame! It just looks like a whole lot of lettuce but it's such a "trendy" spot to go too. 

I did have their clam chowder once which was pretty creamy and delicious - probably full of fat! But I did enjoy it on a cold day. Overall, I would eat here if I really had too I'm just not that impressed by how busy it is for what you're getting at the price. They just basically "fancy-up" their spot when it's really like the Portico down the street or the several Lee's that are nearby that just aren't as "trendy."
author: Priya S.

description:
Consistent!  You know what you're going to walk out with every time.  In a couple dozen visits over the years, this place has proven that.

Only bad thing to say is that the lines are ridiculous, but then again that speaks to the quality of the product.

Imelda (sp?) should get a raise.  While the whole salad team operates smoothly, she smiles with every interaction and actually develops a relationship with her customers.  That's the kind of service that's a tie-breaker win when I can't decide one day between Mixt Greens and Focaccia.  Please recognize what you have in her as an employee.
author: Jon B.

description: I've been coming here for years, picking up my usual small mixed green salad.  This time, the person who made my salad, didn't bother to try to stuff the little pieces of my salad that were sticking over the edges of the container.  She closed the top, then proceeded to use her dirty rag to wipe around the container and the pieces of salad.  EW!!!!  Some pieces of the greens broke, others were just plastered to the side of the container.  Who would want to eat the pieces that were wiped with a dirty rag?!  I went to the garbage, opened up the container and pulled out the pieces on the top of the salad.  I mentioned this to the cashier, who told me to just tell the girl who made my salad.  If I come back and it happens again, I'll make sure the manager hears about it.
author: B C.

description:
Delicious!!! I got a sandwich which was totally up to my standards, because it had all the fancy ingredients I like: 
- fancy spreads like pesto, sun dried tomato paste, and tapenade
- fancy cheeses (gouda, fresh mozzerella, goat cheese)
- fancy meats (prosciutto, smoked salmon)

Avocado was extra, but it always is, and my sandwich came out to be $9.25. Not cheap, but decently priced and it was delicious. I'll definitely be going again, and definitely want to try the salad bar!
author: Jenna G.

description:
My almost daily lunch on the weekdays -- compared to all the "greens" offerings throughout FiDi (Tender Greens, Mixed Greens, you get the point), this is my favorite salad shop! They have a variety of offerings: prepared salads (really good stuff actually-- you can get a caprese salad with delicious mozzarella balls and grape tomatoes in a pesto sauce or a mixed pickled beans salad or a tuna salad etc) for about $3-4, cold/hot sandwiches to order (start at at about $9, so kinda steep for a small sandwich) and the famous salad bar. I always get a small salad with 5 topics for around $7, which is not a bad deal considering that the salad always fills me up and the toppings are fresh and plentiful! 

Tips:
+Trust me when I say you can wait FOREVER to get a salad - the line here is unreal. Although I hate giving away my tips to snag a salad here, get here at 10:50 am. I know that is ridiculous for lunch, but it's the trick to missing that never ending line. Seriously, I have been there at 11 am and you will definitely be waiting in a line.
+Mix your salads! You can get half kale, half mixed or arugula or anything! 
+Meats are an extra $2.50, so pick your toppings wisely (first three non meat toppings are free)
+Grab a free piece of focaccia bread / butter on the way out! A little too greasy/heavy in my opinion, but it's their specialty so worth a try.
+If you're here for breakfast, their scrambles are DELICIOUS and so well priced! And grab a parfait. Yum.
author: Anu P.

description:
Not a bad place for a quick lunch stop. And the prices are relatively reasonable. The salad bar has some good options and your salad will be tossed for you (why are salads SO much better when tossed-life's greatest mysteries). Sometimes the line moves slower than you'd think but still never too long of a wait. 
I've also had the mac n cheese here which is worth getting. 

Note: there is no seating, so it's just a to-go place.
author: Marilyn M.

description:
I got a sandwich, which was great.  Lots of variety to choose from, including an olive mayonnaise spread that, well, tasted like olives.  I mean, I should've known!  But I didn't, and so I was kind of unprepared for the olive flavor...   Well, the bread was good.

I kind of wish they had pre-set sandwiches instead of having you pick everything?  Did I miss it?  Because what I picked did not go together.  Anyway, great place if you are confident in your sandwich item choices.  I, was not, and felt like a lost puppy.  Someone, please just tell me what tastes good together, yea?

I have to ding this place because of the ridiculous lines and poor layout.  I felt like they could have planned the lines much better, what with the sandwich line, where you awkwardly have to step to the side after they put the sandwich into the toaster, and then you step back when they call your sandwich.  I don't know, I didn't like it, and there were no instructions anywhere!  And then after that you have to go to the back and find some line to pay the cashier...  Sigh, it was just all over the place.  I mean really guys, design!!  As if we want to be figuring out your process during our lunch break!!  Yeah, maybe I'm ocd, but the sheer chaos in the atmosphere is enough to not make me want to come back.  Unless I'm really desperate for some creative sandwich or salad.  Meh.
author: Esther S.

description:
My first time in this bakery and yes the food is good but the guy who helped me was very unprofessional. If I hear that you speak Spanish just like me  and I talked to you in Spanish . You as a good employee with customer skills you suppose to help me and not tell me that you speak Italian  boy please !!! I speak 4 languages and I'm sorry I don't speak Italian . I don't know who's the store manager in this location but I hope he/she retrain him because people like him make the business look bad . 
I will never come back again .
author: Rosario H.

description: Pretty solid place here. I've always dropped by the Starbucks right next to this spot and have seen that this place is always busy with lines almost to the door. I came by today because my boss had told me their salads were delicious. I came in around 12:30 today and yes the line was insane. I stood in it about ten to fifteen minutes. I was glad the line moved fairly quickly though, but I will say this is definitely s lunch break not a quick 15 minute stop. I ordered a large salad (I was hungry) with corn, red beans and fresh mozzarella. I ended up adding chicken as well with ranch. The salad was great. The price was not. It was super pricey all that and a drink for $15 bucks. The mozzarella by the way are huge chunks and not shredded like I thought they would be. The salad is delicious though and fresh. I would definitely go back, but probably settle for a small to help not put such a big dent in my wallet!
author: James R.

description: this was one of my favorite places for lunch til today. I am never going back there again!!!!  I ordered 1/4 roast dark chicken with 2 sides (Mac and cheese and mashed potatoes) today. The chicken is raw!!!! how can they serve raw poultry?!!!! I was so disgusted I lost my appetite.
author: Melanie Y.

description:
Is your dream meal a monstrously chunky salad with toppings overfloweth that weighs approximately 2 pounds? Then look no further than Focaccia! I've consistently gone here (and the one in China Basin) for a couple years now and they have consistently put me into greenery-induced coma. Yes, I always get the LARGE, and yes, it usually lasts me two meals unless I'm feeling a little masochistic.

Some of the salad makers are a little more generous than others, so sometimes I am resigned to a 1.5 pound salad instead. First world problems. Anyway, spicy chicken is great! Their greens and toppings are always fresh and great quality - I usually go with mixed greens & arugula with some combination of beets, mushrooms, artichoke, and hearts of palm. Lime vinaigrette is also a winner!

On days I don't feel like braving the line (yes, there's always a line, but it goes pretty fast), I beeline to the hot foods counter (usually no line!) and get their rotisserie chicken! Half a chicken with two sides again covers two meals for about $11! 

Everyone here is pretty friendly and efficient. They are super busy so sometimes can be curt but I've never had a bad experience. I admire their energy and ability to keep up with all these crazy salad-mongers, myself included.

They recently upped their prices due to increased ingredient costs but it's pretty negligible. I definitely like this place way more than the other salad establishments in the neighborhood.
author: Carol C.

description:
Work lunch time is valuable time and there are plenty of good salad/sandwich places to go. I have been super excited to add Focaccia to my list of places but I just  ordered a salad (a co-worker did as well) and we both stopped eating it because we both agreed that our salads were not only unsatisfying but they were generally just bad salads. To elaborate, the dressings are not good and not properly mixed, including the ingredients, and the overall quality of the chicken/other ingredients were poor. There are better places for salad than this. Hope this helps other lunchers out there!  

*side note: I'm told the bread is good there though.
author: Mali C.

description:
I love this place!!! This was my regular lunch place when I was interning in the Financial district. Have tried couple of other salad places in the neighborhood, but this is uneatable in terms of price, quantity, quality and variety of toppings in a salad. Though the lines are long during lunch time, it moves pretty quick. A must try place if you are there around this part of the city. 

Wish they are present in South Bay too :-)
author: Happy P.

description:
This place is awesome. I only moved to San Francisco about a month ago, but I have gone here every almost every weekday for three weeks.

Focaccia is super popular and busy during lunchtime, but the lines move very quickly. They have individual lines for sandwiches, salads, soups, and hot bar. The build-your-own salads are by far the most popular item, and with good reason. They have a very large variety of items, and their portions are huge. You can choose between a "small" and a "large" salad, but unless you haven't eaten in days, the "small" salad will probably do the trick. I myself am a 6'2, 220 lb dude and am typically full after a small salad. I tried the large once and couldn't finish it.

The variety of toppings is what makes this place my favorite. Typically I am suuuuper picky about salads, but this place has every kind of topping you could want (even stuff like strawberries, grapes, goat cheese, unique proteins, etc). To top it off, you get a free, homemade foccacia with your salad (wheat or white). Other salad places may give you a small piece of lame bread, but the focaccia here is large and decadent (honestly you may want to avoid it if you're trying to cut calories, but it's delicious).

They also have great breakfast here - omelettes, egg sandwiches, etc.
author: Nahrek H.

description: Overpriced and terrible service.  The men in the kitchen make it feel like I'm showing up for traffic court and not ordering a bagel.  The past four times that I have gone to Focaccia they have been out of key ingredients such as flavored cream cheese, tomatoes, cucumber, and even bagels!  In addition, when they are out of an ingredient they respond with near irritation that I even ordered that option as if it's inconvenient for them to have to deal with their own shortage of food.  I walked out of Focaccia today and went to Noah's Bagels because I'm so fed up with this location.
author: Cole D.

description:
Impressed how much salad they can squeeze into that little box. I like to call it my brick of salad.

Pricey but love how customized it is. Service can be fast and a little daunting.

1. Get in line, preferably with chatty coworker.
2. Wait.
3. You are next, be prepared to pounce on the person that says next.
4. Tell them what greens you want.
5. They will grab and then look to you for your toppings. Yell out 1 meat and 3 additional toppings.
6.They will hand off you salad to someone on the side for dressing and mixing.
7. Dressing. Light, medium or heavy.
8. They mix it and jam it in the tiny box and then print a price label.
9. Bring salad to register on either end.
10. Pay more than you really want to but you will forget that feeling during the eating of the salad.
author: Ge O.

description:
this is my go-to lunch spot if im craving 1) a made to order salad 2) a delicious hot sandwich with your choice of bread and wayyy too many choices of ingredients or 3) a hot meal of either curry, pork loin with sides like mac n cheese, veggies, etc. etc.

this place is leggittttttt. and all my coworkers love it as well.

only downside - salad line can be a bit traumatizing at times - but then there's always the sando option or the hot lunch, which are much more reasonable and equallly delicious. and they cater! double thumbs up!
author: Christina L.

description:
I actually like Focaccia.  The food is pretty good and I particularly love their salads and hot food offerings.  But their popularity signals their demise.

1) Who on earth is willing to wait so long for salad?  Is it me or has buying salad in this city gotten completely ridiculous? Don't think about coming earlier to beat the line.  I've been here at 11am and the line is there.  Come later and then there is still a line and they run out of some popular ingredients.

2) By noon, a lot of the pre-made salads are gone. Crazy.

3) They have increased their prices by a lot. I normally get the salmon and two sides which use to cost $10.  Today it was $14.  That's a 40% increase folks.  No thanks.

Sadly I will have to find another lunch place.
author: Tomy T.

description:
+Tasty sandwiches
+Large selection of meats, breads, salads, etc.
-Fresh toppings

-Long lines at lunch
-Not too pricey but definitely not cheap (~$11 for just a sandwich)

Recommendation:
Roasted turkey on focaccia
author: Sep N.

description:
This is the closest breakfast/lunch option to my work, so I've been here many, many times. 

I've had bad experiences with the breakfast, including being overcharged, and not getting what I ordered. They also have never updated their menu to indicate all of the options. The menu shows a breakfast sandwich and wrap, but clearly they prepare omelets and non-sandwich-based breakfast plates. They just don't give any information about pricing, so I never order it.

That's a minor annoyance to me, since I seldom order breakfasts. 

I used to get their prepared salads on at least a weekly basis (no way I'm standing in line for a salad), although the last few months I've been bringing lunch from home. But today I picked up one of their prepared salads (small "Oriental" salad) for $7.95, and was pretty shocked to dig into it and realize that they've reduced the amount of food by nearly half. 

See, I deconstruct these pre-packaged salads at my desk before I eat them. I take out the chicken and cut it into pieces, then I pre-cut all of the lettuce, red peppers and two cherry tomatoes. I like chopped salads, so this helps me replicate the chopped salad experience. 

Today I noticed that there is less than half the chicken in the salad that there was in the past. Also, the lettuce used to be packed tightly into the clamshell, so that when I cut it and tossed it around, it was overflowing the plastic bowl. I actually felt that there was too much lettuce, and the full container of dressing was just enough to cover it all. Today I noticed that all the salads only took up half the clamshells, and none of them seemed to be tightly packed. There's probably half the lettuce that they used to use. Still two cherry tomatoes though. And a full cup of dressing, which I only needed to use half of, and still wound up with pools of dressing at the bottom when finished.

I don't like it when places try to increase their margins by sneakily reducing the servings. I'd prefer a straight-forward price increase, or some other clear declaration. 

Finally, there was one incident where a miscommunication between me and the breakfast cook led to be being overcharged for what I ordered. The manager came over and immediately took the cook's side, suggesting that I was trying to somehow scam them. After I explained what had happened, and she realized that it was a miscommunication about the order, she relented, but I was so shocked that her immediate position was to attack the customer. 

I now avoid this place, only going in if I can't find a yogurt parfait anywhere else. And after today, I see no reason to go back.
author: Alex K.

description:
My go-to salad spot in fidi. The salads are amazing (you build your own) at a very affordable price point (unlike mixt greens)! The selection that they have to build your salad is amazing - love that they have butternut squash! 

This place is super busy around peak lunch times - if you have the ability to go a little early (11:30) or a little late (12:45) you'll skip the majority of the line.
author: Alison Y.

description:
Smoked salmon on ciabatta roll.  OMG that was the best build your own sandwich.  Healthy too considering I had fish!  I also ordered a sundried tomato spread, provolone cheese, lettuce, cucumbers and red onions.  The food was good and filling.  At about $7 it is a pretty good deal too.

Service was friendly and quick.

Cookies are $1.75 - still a bargain considering Starbucks charges more now.
author: Wendy H.

description:
Nice Atmosphere
Good Selection of Food
Watch your meal made fresh
author: Lauren S.

description: Much better than Mixt Greens, for a few dollars cheaper. Can't really complain about this place. They really pack a bunch of salad into the container. I usually get the romaine lettuce, with chicken, spicy tofu, olives, and heart of palms.
author: Corey H.

description:
Focaccia is a decent spot. Came here today to meet a friend for lunch, and in general we were pretty satisfied with what we got.

I went with the 1/2 chicken plate which isn't a bad deal since it comes with two sides (options like mac and cheese, mashed potatoes, salad, etc). However the chicken itself was average, and even though you get a lot of food by the end I wasn't dying to finish it. 

More importantly...BE AWARE: This place gets absolutely packed at lunch. We came at 12:30 and it was a MISTAKE. Certainly it was the usual lunch hour rush, but the lines were moving very, very slowly which is obviously frustrating. I couldn't even mess around with the sandwich or salad lines because they were 20 people deep, which was disappointing. So I was all but forced into ordering the chicken. 

However, there are three good things about the place: 1) Lots of options for lunch, 2) Fairly priced, 3) Great location (esp. if you work in Embarcadero Center)

All-in-all this place is solid, if unspectacular. Hate to give it three stars, but thats honestly what my experience was.
author: Brian S.

description:
My company just moved into the building where this establishment is located so this place seemed ideal for our weekly company lunches.  I ordered 3 salads and 3 wraps online this past weekend for Mondays lunch, if you want to order chips or side salads they do have a min order of 8 for those items.  The wraps are wrapped in foil but 2 of them had the foil ripped, they were a decent size.  I was really disappointed in the salads which are 1/2 the size of the ones we order from Specialty's, the ingredients were stuffed in a small container.  One of the salads came with brown apples, it looks like the catering is brought into this location and not made at this location which I assumed they did.  

On Tuesday I placed an order online for bagels and again I was a little disappointed, I paid almost $45 for 12 bagels and 2 fruit containers.  They gave us 3 onion bagels, 3 plain, 3 sesame seed, 1wheat, 2 poppy seed..... Really 3 Onion bagels for a morning business breakfast! I thought we would get at least one blueberry, egg, or pesto and an assortment of cream cheeses, I received just plain cream cheese, jelly and butter.  

The employees are not very friendly and when you ask a question on where to pick up an order they just point and say go to the next register and it's hard to understand since the two women I spoke with had thick accents.  The morning manager called on my order to see where it was and spoke another language which I think is wrong and bad customer service.  Speak English and let me know what your saying about me and my order.  

I will be looking for other establishments for our weekly lunches.
author: LaTonya F.

description: Yet another place in SOMA to get a made to order salad.  Didn't try the non-salad options but they do have several.  Very long line at lunch time but there is plenty of room inside so even if it's raining (it was) you're not in a line out the door (like some other salad places were that day).  All the typical choices of greens, proteins and veg, so not terribly different from other places, but high quality food, delivered efficiently.  Pretty solid.
author: Alan R.

description: Incredibly good value lunch spot given that it's in downtown SoMA. Reliably fresh ingredients, the place is clean, and there's all kinds of options. I tend to get an arugula salad with goat cheese, walnuts, caramelized apples, and croutons with bread on the side, and it's only $6.45. Lots of healthy options. The service is harried but friendly. Love this place.
author: Katie K.

description:
Ate breakfast at the cafe.  $7.45 for the Joe's special omelet.  Nothing special.  Under salted.  I've had better tasting and more generous portion omelets at an IHOP. Served in a cardboard take out carton.  Crappy plastic forks / knives complete the setup.

Dining area is spartan. The one dining counter is just 14 inches deep.  Your nose is inches from the brick wall while you chew.  6 uncomfortable chairs.  Greeter/Cashier was friendly and pleasant.  Short order cook was abrupt, surly, and not friendly.

I'd return to get a prepackaged salad or a morning pastry.  Would not return for cafe meal.
author: Tom S.

description:
The food is excellent and the staff is too. However, management has some very odd views of customer service. In the middle of the lunch hour rush the salad line snakes 3 times out to the main floor. In the middle of the rush, they decide to close down 50% of the salad making bar??

When asked why, manager says they are not shutting down but just replenishing the other side - right as they shut down the one side. The other manager says the workers need breaks??

Very bizarre attitude about their customers.
author: Carter D.

description:
You can't do better in terms of value than Focaccia. For $6.50 you can get a small (it's not actually that small) salad with fresh, tasty ingredients-all made to order.

Now that I've found Focaccia, it's just hard to justify getting a $13 + salad from Mixt Greens or Tender Greens.

They also make sandiwches and have a variety of hot items. If you haven't tried it yet and work in FiDi, it might just become your new lunch spot..!
author: Rachel L.

description:
Pros: 
 - Delicious food
 - Salad:  fresh, variety of toppings and greens to choose from.   I like the lemon chicken with romaine, carrots, caramelized walnuts, parmesan cheese and balsamic vinaigrette.  Yum!
 - Hot food:  I love their pork roast and sides are usually good

Cons:
 - VERY VERY long salad line during lunch hour.  Get there early to beat the lunch rush
 - BAD SERVICE:  Most of employees in the salad line act like they are doing you a big favor for making you a salad.  The minute you step up to the counter, you better know exactly what you want because if you hesitate, they give you that annoyed look. I always feel so rushed.  There are a couple ladies there who actually do smile and are nicer but for the most part, the employees have really bad attitude.

This place is still my fave place to go if I'm in the mood for salad.  Just be warned that  you might not get excellent service and the lines will be long.
author: Rhea Mae A.

description:
Ants on the baked goods, no thanks! While they looked delicious, I had enough protein for the day.

Sam out.
author: Sean Z.

description: first time customer- came in a got a made to order salad (mixed greens, chicken, cucumber, red bell pepper) and one item I didn't order - a LIVE grasshopper!  I almost threw up.. It went in the trash and I will never come back
author: J R.

description: Super convenient - right on Market street - I usually go with the oven toasted sandwiches which are nice - they usually have diet lemon snapple which I am a fan of.  The line moves quick and it is a good consistent lunch.
author: Philippe C.

description:
Focaccia is amaze balls. I decided to try it out for lunch because one of my peers at GGU around the corner always is eating a pasta salad from this place during our Tuesday night class. 

I'm so glad I discovered this place now because they make really great tossed salads and is super convenient to where I educate myself. 

I was here around 11:30 pm right before lunch hour. There was already a pretty big line for the salad bar but it was moving pretty fast. They have huge trays of different types of lettuce in the back. Very trendy and visually appealing. You can tell that this place tries real hard to attract customers. I think they're doing a good job. 

I made it to the front of the line within 4 minutes. I ordered a spinach and romaine salad with broccoli, mushrooms, and Parmesan cheese, baby shrimp, and tossed with lime vinaigrette. I ordered a small but the salad was quite large. My order also came with a piece of focaccia bread. 

I went back to school and scarfed the entire thing down and used the bread to sponge up the leftover dressing. I didn't even realize I had been that hungry! The salad was thaaat good!

4 stars and not 5 because the salad was pretty expensive. The leaf and three toppings were pretty cheap (around 6 bux) but the tiny scoop of baby shrimp was an additional 3 dollars. I don't know if I'll get in my salad the next time unless I'm really craving it. 

I'll be back Focaccia. Probably tomorrow.
author: Vidya K.

description:
The lines were a little too long for me - when I popped in here for a quick perusal of this spot - but what I saw - i definitely dug.

Salads and fruit bowls to go, make your own salads with the option to have fresh salmon on top (now that's what's up). An enticing make your own sandwich area, and they even have a decent breakfast selection too. 

The layout of this space was impressive. It's vast and open so despite the lines - there's still plenty of room to move around and survey their hanging menus. Healthy options like this spot definitely intrigue me - so I'm looking forward to making a return visit to try their salad with salmon.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
I'm a fan of Focaccia. It's a nice change of pace from the usual salad joints. I mean, you get to make your own! So much freedom! Unless you get overwhelmed by choices... (which does happen to me sometimes). Prices are pretty decent and I LOVE the small salad option. I mean, sometimes I don't want an entire head of lettuce in my salad (seriously what is with these HUGE salad portions in San Francisco?!).

There are two lines: one for salads, one for sandwiches. Yes, the lines are long, but it gives me time to piece something together. I like to have two options in mind by the time I get to the front, just in case.
author: Katrina H.

description: This place is pretty decent.  It's a healthy choice for lunch, it's really close to my work, and I actually feel full from their salads, even if I don't add meat (pretty large portions for a small).  My only complaint is that depending on who you get, you may get really skimpy toppings.  The bread that comes with the salad is pretty good. This place isn't that cheap, but you can't get anything "cheap" for lunch in the FiDi.  Also since I can only eat about half of the small salad each time, the cost split between 2 meals isn't bad. It's pretty much one of the only super healthy lunch options.  I've tried their hot food before too, and that was okay.  I like their salads better; the hot food can be pretty heavy.  The lines are very long during lunch time, so make sure you go no later than 11:15 or so if you want to beat the crowd.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Eh, it's just ok. Here's my rundown:

Portions - huge. No complaints!
Ingredients: plentiful. Endless combinations makes this place repeat-worthy without getting bored at all.
Flavors - Wellllll, here's where they fell flat. The salad dressing was super bland, and the bread was, well, kind of stale. 
Pricing - Pretty reasonable for being in the Financial District.

I'm docking them another star for the lack of seating options. I had to fight someone from Starbucks to get a table in the courtyard. 

If you're running out to grab something to go, then this place will do. Otherwise, I'd recommend any of the other nearby options for lunch.
author: Shachi B.

description:
I'm obsessed with this place!  Actually, I like the one on Sacramento Street better. The lines are way shorter and the salad portions are larger (they jam pack the small salads there).  But regardless, this place is seriously amazing and offers great food for a very reasonable price. 

Salads - LOVE LOVE LOVE.  The small is pretty substantial and for the price that they charge, it's great!  $5.75 for a small included with three toppings.  The lines start at 11:15am, although they do move fast.  I'd say with a line all the way by the condiment section, you're waiting for about 15 to 20 mins total.  Pretty sure it's not organic at that price, but still offers great value for a tasty salad. 

Hot Foods - when I want comfort foods, this hot bar is right on the money.  Best over-the-counter mac-n-cheese!  Try it with the hot sauce packets they offer as condiments.  The entrees vary, but for $10 and some change, you get a whole lotta bang for your buck. And it's good tasty food.  Don't say I didn't warn you though, that mac-n-cheese is addicting.   Almost never a wait here, especially compared to the salad section.

No seats, but great for take-away.  Check it out!
author: Mary N.

description:
I've never had the time to wait through the salad line, but it must be good judging by the sheer number of people. 

Sandwiches are the best in the FiDi. A little more expensive than somewhere like Miss Tomato, but there are so many interesting options I don't think I'll ever get through every delicious idea I've gotten into my head. Great bread, lots of cheese (including mozzarella and goat cheese!), meat specials every day, and the option to get a half sandwich instead of a whole. I'm also a fan of consistency, and the same extremely friendly guy has been making sandwiches since I started coming here as an intern in the summer of 2011.
author: Eve D.

description:
The Focaccia Mkt & Bakery just opened in South San Francisco in the Centennial Towers bldg right off of Oyster Pt/Sister Cities Blvd.  Why so secretive about it?  No advertising, no menu, no mention on their website, just word of mouth is how I learned it had opened.   And, boy, am I glad I did! 

Fresh salad bar, sandwich counter, hot entree counter,  a coffee and pastry counter, what more can u ask for?!  I have visited every counter and it's all been delicious and fresh.  So far I've tried the chicken Marsala , a tuna sandwich, Chinese Ckn salad and can't forget the cookies. Oh yeah, the cookies- chocolate chip, choc chip w/walnuts (my fave), oatmeal & peanut butter cookies!  They also have packaged pastas and salads to choose from. 
 
I'm a fan and plan on going tomorrow and picking up lunch to go. I'm not sure if they will ever put tables & chairs in for dining or if it's just still too new but right now it's all to go. 

Check them out, you won't b disappointed!
author: T T.

description:
I don't know why this place isn't 100% 5 star reviews!  I absolutely love it and its the cheapest salad I've ever gotten in the city.  The ingredients are fresh and plenty.  While the service staff can be a bit off putting, at least they get the job done in (most often) a speedy and efficient manner.  All I can attest to is the salad bar.  

I have yet to try the sandwich bar or carvery station.  But you get a free slice of bread with your item (yay)!  The baked goods are buy one get one free after 2pm.
