They also have an extensive case of prepared salads, sandwiches, etc. with a good drink selection if you are in a time crunch, but I never stand in line longer than ten minutes (unlike some places in the financial district). 

I (HEART) you Foccacia, and I don't think it's just a fall fling!
author: Ali B.

description:
Don't let the ridiculously long make-your-own salad line turn you off of Focaccia.  The pre-made salads are delish and this place is VERY reasonably priced for FiDi.  Also, the check out lady is super fast. If you get a pre-made salad, you could easily be in and out of there at peak lunch hour in three minutes.  No joke. 

I had the small salmon salad which was PLENTY of food.  IMO, they sell the salads in two sizes: plenty and way too much :) but either way, a great value! Plus, the free, deliciously buttery bread compliments any salad perfectly.
author: Hannah C. R.

description:
Ordered a toasted bagel with butter. Got my bagel. It was not toasted at all. With hardly any butter. 

I thought about getting some oatmeal - but i saw what was in there - it was so soupy - it looked like grits. Gross.

All the pre-made foods - don't have any of the ingredients listed. So if you have any food allergies - you are SCREWED. I wish there was some law about deli's listing ingredients on packed foods here, so no one would get sick.
author: Erin F.

description: They put a lot of thought into Focaccia. To beat the lunch crowd they have two large entrances on different streets. They have a separate salad and sandwich section along with separate drinks section. Also, there were two separate cashiers to make payments quicker. I loved that a full sandwich is $7 which is $2 more than Subway across the way for a far better sandwich. You can also customize a sandwich with different breads, meats etc. I had a prosciutto sandwich with fresh mozzarella and sundried tomatoes. I'd definitely go back.
author: Carlos A.

description:
This is my default lunch place.  I can come here everyday and I do come here every time I go into my office unless another place is suggested.

My default: a small kale salad with quinoa, beets and mozzarella with light raspberry dressing.  Oh don't forget the lemon pepper chicken or spicy chicken.  It's full of nutrients and delicious!!  Oh it also comes with a piece of focaccia bread and you can do regular or wheat.  I always eat the salad for lunch then save the wheat focaccia for later in the afternoon so I can stay filled until dinner.  

What's even better?  All that is only $8!  I think that's cheap for a salad like this anywhere! Not to mention this is at a very central/expensive location.  The same thing at Tender Greens would cost $18.
author: Emily W.

description:
Three separate lines:  Hot Food, Salads, and Sandos

Reasonably priced salads for the area.  3 mix-ins and a meat for $8.95?  Sure.

The only thing to watch out for is the line.  If you can make it there before 11:30 or after 1:30, not an issue, any other time, it'll take you a good 10 - 15 minutes to get in and out.
author: David L.

description: If you go between 11:30am and 1pm you will have to wait a long time to get a salad.  They are good, but what a wait.  Entrées are expensive but good, unfortunately the accompanying vegetables are steamed, soggy and boring.  Now these things would garner an average (3 star) rating from me were it not for the check-out clerks who rarely smile, and impart a stressful sense of urgency on you to pay and get out.
author: Mark F.

description: My favorite lunch spot as I can never get enough of the filling salads!! You basically customize your own and the ingredients are all super fresh. Generally a small is more than big enough, and then you can choose the type of lettuce, 3 toppings (for free), and then if you so choose, add meat/seafood, and then they'll ask you for light/medium/heavy dressing. The container is jam packed (which I love) and I always feel satisfied after eating the salad. Definitely takes salads to a whole new level!
author: Jessica X.

description: Better than the Sacramento street location, but just as crowded.  Skip the long lines and go with the hot food section or the already prepped stuff in the fridge.  Sandwiches and salads are pricey, so that's one reason why I go with the hot food section and the portions are huge.  The rotisserie chicken is a winner and their veggies are good too.  The mac n cheese ain't bad either and same with the pasta.
author: Cat C.

description:
On my way to work, there are three places I can get a hot breakfast. At two of them, I feel like a hog about to be slopped. At this, I feel like a guest in a reasonably priced hotel. 

An omelet bar. A case of random pastries that look better than they usually are. Some fruit. Is it ripe? Roll the dice.

The staff is reasonably friendly, if a bit gruff. If there was a do it yourself waffle maker, the Radisson experience would be complete. Avoid the oatmeal. It. Is. Awful.
author: Rob F.

description: Good quality fresh food.  Rotating specials.  Decent value... lunch here can eliminate the need for dinner!   Only knock is the L   O      O           O              N                      G     salad line.  Pays to be a carnivore here if you are short of time.
author: Bob K.

description: This is the pork loin with mac n cheese & mash for sides. However, I thought the pork was a little too sweet & slightly dry. I'm not sure why people have raved about the mac n cheese, to be blunt it was very greasy. I ate less than half & gave the leftovers to a homeless man. Shortly after eating I felt sick.
author: B K.

description:
This place hit the spot for lunch #eatlunch. 

I had the focaccia sandwich on wheat with salmon, cheese, salad, tomatoes, and cucumbers on top. The sandwich was amazing, very fresh, and  just the perfect size.

This place has many option for custom sandwiches and salads. Most items are around or under $10.

They will get my business again. Make sure to give them a try if you're in the area.
author: Tim R.

description: Focacia has been my go to affordable salad place down town for awhile which is a blessing but something has changed in the last few months. Frankly the salads just don't taste like much of anything anymore, it's completely flavorless. If a change has been made to the dressings or something please reverse it!
author: Lea W.

description:
I'm in the office building above this lunch spot and I can see why it's so popular (on top of its convenience). 

The hot foods are quite a good deal if you're looking for a lot of food. I have tried the rotisserie chicken and beef brisket which were both quite excellent. The focaccia is good too (as expected when you name your place after it).

The price is a little high but what would you expect at a more upscale to go lunch spot in the financial district. 

The only major problem is the line. If you go there before 12pm, you have a shot of making it out of there in a reasonable time frame. 

I wish the place stayed open to 6pm so I could get dinner here.
author: Victor W.

description: I LOVED the idea. However, the chicken salad was too lemony. (I liked the peas though). The small sized salad was GARGANTUAN.  The honey mustard was overly creamy and had no honey nor mustard flavor. I need a do-over b/c I really really want to like it.
author: Andrew K.

description:
My boyfriend recommended this place for lunch because it was close to his office and he loves focaccia (perfect right?).

From what I could see when I first walked in the door, there are technically two sections that you can go to: the already prepared food, and the made to order customizable food. Unfortunately I didn't get a chance to really take a look around the prepared food section since I heard it has some pretty good stuff. 

I got the smoked salmon sandwich. Not too bad except the guy behind the counter gave me an extra chunk of salmon in the middle of the sandwich, which you think would be a good thing but it overwhelmed the sandwich and made it taste a little bit too fishy so I ended up picking out the extra fish. My boyfriend got the roast beef which I thought was a little on the dry side (even though it was flavored very nicely). 

What I loved the most was that you could build your own sandwich from ingredients that looked fresh and they had a variety of choices that you wouldn't be able to find at your local subway (like the smoked salmon). The sandwich sizes were pretty big too. I could only finish half but since it is on the pricier side, i was expecting a lot of food. I grabbed a piece of focaccia bread at the checkout counter and I can see why they decided to name themselves after it. Very light and fluffy texture with a perfect amount of salt and oil. That was probably the best part of the entire meal. 

Note: When I went, there was a pretty long line for both the salad and the sandwiches and I have been told it is pretty much like that everyday so don't expect this to be the place to grab a quick bite (unless you get the already prepared food). Especially with the sandwiches, they heat up the bread and meat so it will take a little bit of time. Also, there is no where to sit even though it is such a large place. 

Overall three stars because they have decent food, selections, and portions but the price and the wait time make this a place I probably will not frequent very often. Maybe I will try the prepared food next time since it cuts out the wait time.
author: Julie Z.

description:
So, $8 for a "small" salad (which is not in *any* way small) is quite a bargain, by any standard. Add some delicious meat, and you have a lunch. 

The one gripe I have is that they don't offer pre-canned suggestions for salads. Each time, you have to grapple with a huge list of ingredients to build your own. Makes for longer lines, and makes it a challenge to switch it up from the tried and tested salad options. 

Other than that? Lovely. Small spinach salad, carmelized walnuts and pears, blue cheese, spicy chicken. Go.
author: Brett W.

description:
Yay, Focaccia! (I'm shocked that the reviews for this place aren't consistently high...)

You know that thought you have when you're deciding where to go to lunch? You know the "Why didn't I just pack something healthy so I can save some money and avoid eating crap?" thought? We've all had it...usually on our walk-o-shame over to The Melt, followed by scarfing down cheese and bread with some high-calorie, creamy soup. Well, feel guilty no more! If you forget your lunch and want something cheap and healthy, Focaccia is the place to go! 

Here's how it works. You choose a green (spinach, arugula, mixed greens, etc.), three additional ingredients (nuts, cheese, veggies, berries, protein--i.e. chicken, quinoa), dressing, and tell the lovely people behind the counter who promptly toss the salad together and put it in a little container so it's all ready to go. The small containers cost $5 and change and they're definitely big enough to fill up a moderately hungry person. Aaaand they come with a little side of bread (you have to grab those at the cash register). 

The people are nice and speedy. There are prepared foods in coolers along the walls if you prefer a sandwich or pasta salad or (mmmm) fresh caprese salad to traditional greens or if you just want to grab a fancy (aka something other than water) drink to complete your lunch. 


It's awesome. That's all there is to it.
author: Kimberly A.

description:
This is one of my favorite lunch spots. I came here three times thus far, tried their salads and their sandwiches. They have a large variety of toppings to choose from, but I somehow just love the smoked salmon and the goat cheese in both my sandwich and my salads. I love their soy sesame dressing! I usually get my salads like this: spring mix with corn, tomatoes, goat cheese, smoked salmon, and soy sesame. They toss it up for you too. I have yet to try their hot foods, but my coworkers tell me they're delicious too, with the chicken and the mash potatoes or something like that.

I try to avoid ordering salads there when it gets super busy. Last time I did, the lady added the wrong dressing to another person's salad when she was supposed to be working on mine. I ordered a large salad but in the end she packed it in a small box. Put in the wrong type of salmon. If I am able to customize my salads, I should be able to get it the way I ordered. This kind of service is unacceptable...
author: Connie C.

description: This place is pretty good, i like the half chickens/hot bar, and sides.  My friends like the salads.
author: Michael E.

description: Came here for a quick lunch and from the reviews on Yelp but wasn't impressed.  I got an already made salad from the cold shelves and it was just ok.  The pears were kinda of mushy and not fresh.  I think if I were to go back I would get a fresh salad - made to order - but I'd have to time it better because I went before noon and the line was still very long.  Also it's very strange but there are no trash cans outside and the only one inside was kind of tiny.
author: Amanda K.

description: Great sandwiches. Good for lunch but very busy at 12. Lines are really long. The ready made sandwiches are actually very good. So if you're not in the mood to wait in line it's a great option.
author: Yasi N.

description: Clean and healthy food place with a lot of different selections. Great to come in and grab a quick lunch before heading back to the office for work
author: Kevin Z.

description:
I work across the street from Focaccia and go there a few times a week for a salad. 

I *love* this place. Here's why:

1) Tons of ingredients to choose from and it's always very, very fresh.
2) The large salads I get there are probably two pounds of food - seriously, it's a big heavy box of salad.
3) $10.50 for a huge salad with a very generous portion of chicken added - the lemon chicken added is amazing.
4) These people are FAST. Even when the line looks crazy long, it's only a few minutes.

5) The staff is incredible! Seriously, they are always nice. Every one of them. And, as noted above, efficient, too. I don't know how the manager finds (and keeps) these folks but kudos. 

I think I am pretty picky when it comes to customer service and making sure I'm not paying too much (Mixt Greens) for lunch, so Focaccia is my favorite lunch place by a a mile. Actually, two miles.

Keep it up, guys! You're awesome.
author: Steven H.

description:
I have ordered sandwiches from here, salads, and hot food a couple times. but most recently, I got the meatloaf lunch combo. It was pricey at $10.99 plus tax for lunch, but the meatloaf, mashed potatoes and vegetables were really good. I must admit my love for comfort food is pretty strong :) The meatloaf had really yummy juices and sauce and I could tell it had a good amount of cheese in the meat mixture. Healthy? No! Delicious? Hell yes!

If you don't mind spending a little more, check out the hot foods section. I feel like not enough people look into it because they are too busy waiting in the too-long salad bar line.

Three stars and not four because of the high prices. If my meal was $3 less, you guys would be getting a 4 from me right now.
author: Alanna R.

description:
As a general rule, I don't like to eat at one place several times (unless its food is mind-blowingly good). But I have a soft spot for Focaccia's sandwiches. Actually, I have several soft spots BECAUSE of all the sandwiches I eat; seriously, I can show you.

On second thought, nevermind.

I do really like this place, even though it hasn't got mind-blowingly tasty eats. It's located conveniently close to me, and it's also got some great breakfast (wraps, bagels, oatmeal, pastries) and lunch (salads, sandwiches) items. Though it's not cheap (~$10 for a sandwich or salad), it helps that the staff is always oddly cheery and incredibly helpful.

And when I feel like those soft spots are a bit TOO soft, I opt for a small, healthful salad: spinach, strawberries, candied walnuts, hold the dressing. Perfection.
author: Adena B.

description:
Okay, I'm a believer. I must have walked in and out of the place at least 5 different times. The lines were always long, and the prices scared me a little. But today, my stomach told me to just give it a try so I did.

I got the roasted turkey sandwich on focaccia with caper mayo. Including chips, my total came out to $10.15. It's a little more than I wanted to spend on lunch today, but man, the bread is fresh and you can really taste the herbs in it. Also, that caper mayo is to die for! Next time I'll have to get it on both sides of the focaccia.
author: Manda W.

description:
Good food. Bad service. 
Went there for breakfast to get some scrambled eggs. Got told one price for an item and then was charged more than double for it (including an additional hand written charge after the bill slip had been printed that had no explanation). When I asked ask the counter about the price change and the difference between what I was charged and the posted price, I was told "I don't know, get back in line and ask the chef." I won't be coming back. There are far too many amazing restaurants in SF to go back to one that treats people like this.
author: Carrie P.

description:
I waited a few weeks for the lines to shorten before I headed in for lunch today. The line for salad still being way too long for me to handle waiting in, I opted for the sandwich line which had significantly fewer people in. Now I know why. The line moves SO slowly. That big group hanging out to the left? They're not socializing, they're waiting for their food to come out of the oven. Which means just when you think you're ready to order there's lettuce and tomato to be put on someone else's. Blah.

Was my sandwich ok? Yes it was. Do I think the roast beef at Lee's is way better and costs half as much? Yes I do. Maybe I just ordered the wrong thing but I don't think this place is anything special. That said, the convenience of it alone is 3 stars.
author: Rachel E.

description:
I like this place for many reasons. It's just steps away from my office, and no matter what I get here, I'm never disappointed. 

The first time I came here was a year ago. I was a scared newby on my first day at work for a Fortune 500 Company in the heart of the Financial District. I was nervous, and just like any overachieving newcomer, I was ridiculously early for work.

So I stopped inside Focaccia and grabbed a pumpkin muffin from their pastry section. I was blown away at how good it was that I came back the next day for another muffin. And then the next day... and the day after that...

Finally I realized I needed to try something other than their muffins, so over the course of a year, I'm pretty sure I've had something from every station that Focaccia has to offer. That's probably not something I should be proud of haha. 

The staff has always been great, considering how busy and crazy it gets in here. I've witnessed the relentless and rude FiDi employees that seem to think it's okay to treat working people like dirt just to get a salad. The staff always remains poised and professional and works quickly to get orders through. 

Oh, and I also love the rotating floral arrangements that they have everyday =)

 I feel like people expect way too much out of this place. Let's face it, the reason why you and I keep coming back is because the quality of the food is great, and you can't get anything fresher or faster on your lunch break.
author: Mary S.

description: I ended up eating at this deli because my car broke down outside and I had to wait for a tow truck.  The salad bar is great and had super choices!  But more importantly, the staff was amazing!  They let me stay in the deli with my 3 month old twins as I waited hours for the tow truck.  (It was too hot to sit in a dead car with infants or outside.). They kindly even let me stay after they closed but while they were cleaning.  Very nice people and tasty food!
author: Denise B.

description:
Nice little spot here to pick up either hot food or salads.  Went here with a former co-worker for lunch and got a 3 item hot plate of goodness.  Order the roast, mac and cheese and mashed potatoes.  I was "carb loading", lol.  But that Mac and Cheese hit the spot.  It's cheesy and creamy and full of guilt, but it was delicious.  The potatoes were alright, no biggie.  The roast was cooked well, wasn't dry, but it wasn't as soft as I'd like.  Kinda tough to tear apart with a plastic fork, but the flavors were good.

There's no place to dine, it's more of a pick up and go spot.  Fairly pricy, about $10 bucks for 3 items, but it's not that bad all things considered.
author: Jeremaine R.

description:
I'm smiling as I write this review because I've never seen going here as much of a pleasure. It's right across the street from my office, and often times I'm thinking about something work related that just happened or is about to happen when I bring my salad back to my desk. 

But I always get a great, healthy meal here, something that won't put me to sleep at 2pm. My default is pretty simple: a small salad (this is really a normal serving size, not small at all) with a mixed greens or spinach base; toppings of beets, grilled mushrooms, and sprouts; and grilled salmon on top of that. The salad with three ingredients is between $5 and $6, and the grilled salmon addition is $3. Avocado, I think, is another $1. You can ask them to mix dressing right into the salad or take some away on the side. 

The food here is healthy and low cost, a great default choice for anyone working in the area.
author: Bee L.

description:
Cutting corners.

Waiting got me this: http://www.yelp.com/biz/focaccia-market-and-bakery-san-francisco#hrid:O5vMvLvBIfby2BqV-OioAw

Not waiting in a long line for a sandwich at their new location got me this: Forgettable cajun chicken breast and a side of greasy veggies from the warm plates.

Perhaps that the majority of veggies were mushrooms influenced the review. Because there were quite a few. Which doesn't matter when you dislike mushrooms.

Complementary piece of focaccia might have been the best part.

Be sure to confirm the price. Person at the register assumed I had two sides based on the container. $8 was already enough. $10 would have been a ripoff. 

Next time will show more patience.
author: Jason B.

description: Sandwiches are eh... salads are eh... hot food  is great.   Service is improving.  Will report back soon.
author: Price L.

description: Always a long line but it moves pretty quickly! They have a wide selection of choices, and my salads are always yummy and satisfying. Just make sure to tell the person making your salad to toss it really well. I've found large chunks of ingredients clumped together in the middle of my salad on more than one occasion, and it's pretty hard to mix it up yourself once it's in the container since they really pack it in there.
author: Krizia M.

description:
Ladies and gents. May I present to you, the best salad in the Financial District!

- Spinach base
- Spicy chicken bits
- Edamame beans
- Chick peas
- Musrooms/Onions
- Jalapenos. Yes. Jalapenos.
- Light honey mustard dressing

I call it the Yelp!

And you can perfect it, or any other salad, at Focaccia for around $8, including a piece of heavenly soft bread. Drool.
author: Nick A.

description: Good place to pick up lunch in the FiDi. The lines are long, but it goes by fairly quickly. It's a great option for hot foods, sandwiches, or salads (especially if you want something cheaper than Mixt Greens). I like to come here to switch it up once in awhile.
author: Kristen C.

description:
This is one of my favorite lunch spots in FIDI! Everything tastes super fresh--sandwiches, salads, ingredients. And what I love most about this place is that you can get HALF of things. When I go around to other lunch sandwich/salad spots, I have to end up saving half of my salad or sandwich. And I hate eating leftovers. 

And I also really like how you can customize all your orders with exactly what you want inside. And they have so many selections for cheeses (gouda, brie, mozzarella, jack, cheddar, etc), and different types of meat. And so many caramelized fruits and nuts for salads. 

Great and healthy place!
author: Jeanette S.

description: Came here at 11:30am for lunch and beat the lunch crowd. I ordered a small salad, which starts at $5.75, and you get the first 3 toppings for free. A small is big enough, and sometimes they give you so much that they end up putting your "small" salad into a large container. I picked mozarella, mushrooms, and caramelized onions as my toppings, then I added avocado for 75 cents and salmon for $2.50. Wow that added quickly to $9. The salad was delicious! -- especially the caramelized onions, salmon, and avocado. Come here for lunch if you work in the financial district! :)
author: Amanda C.

description: Pleasantly surprised by how good their breakfast was!! The don't skimp on ingredients which I appreciate. Everything was fresh and tasted great. Will definitely be coming back!
author: Kristen M.

description:
I tried one of their salads yesterday and I was impressed.

I made a small cob and even with the add-on's it was $7.20.  I'm really happy with the prices.  I had breakfast and lunch yesterday for $10.75.  I like that.

There were more options for muffins this morning.  I saw Cranberry, Blueberry, Chocolate chip, Banana Nut, and Pumpkin.  I thought I had grabbed a banana nut and when I got up stairs and bit into it, realized it was apple cinnamon.  Oh well...I'm not picky.

Lets see what today's lunch has in store...
author: Sofia H.

description: 50% of the time I come here I'm sorry I walked the extra block.  They are slow and constantly out of breakfast items.  Over priced and arrogant employees.
author: Heinz G.

description:
Focaccia is great - lots of options and I especially like that their salads are not based on weight, but number of topping, since I like to add artichoke hearts and beets which always weigh my salads down at other places.

For $10 I can get a large salad with 6 veggies - cant be beat for downtown area on weekdays.

Breakfast sandwiches/wraps are a great option too!
author: Ennis O.

description:
Great salads, Sammie's and breakfast serving the business crowd in the area.

Sadly, I used to come here every Friday to get a breakfast croissant, but for  the past month they've been out of croissants when I come in at 9:30!
author: Michelle L.

description: Worst service ever, cooks brains are not evolved, they take several orders at a time and mix up your order with someone else....they forget what was said...the very basic things a chef should know and they seem to miss them...how stupid on earth
author: Manoj K.

description: Beautiful space, great bagel bar. Had a delicious bagel with mix and the works for less than $8. Will be back.
author: NJ Dad K.

description:
I've eaten here for lunch almost every day for over a year, the food is that good. The salads are as fresh as you could ever hope for, the sandwiches are thick and interesting, even the soups are delicious. I especially recommend the split pea soup with bacon. If you need a quick coffee in the morning, they have good coffee and there is a nice baked goods selection to choose from.

Moreover the people who work here are really nice.

The only catch is that this place is really popular, so the salad line is long. There is a single salad line that filters into around 6 stations, but with 6 stations the line moves quickly. Whatever the line length is, divide it by 6 to get an adjusted length before walking away from what may well be your next go-to lunch spot.
author: Jacob S.

description:
(Just an additional note - since my first two reviews, the new Facaccia has become much busier.  If you are going at lunchtime, expect for there to be a considerable lineup.  I am not changing my rating.  I am just noting that it is much busier now.)

http://tinyurl.com/3rz6gn9

This is a follow up. Since opening a couple of weeks ago, Focaccia Market and Bakery has become an office favorite.

A couple of days ago, I went again. I ordered the pork loin with two sides. The flavors were mostly pretty good. The pork have a very nice sweet flavor. The macaroni and cheese was a bit bland. One negative though is that it wasn't really hot. It was barely warm. They need to crank up their warming bins. It was still a good lunch at a pretty decent price. It was very filling and the lunch came in at around 8 bucks plus a drink.

http://tinyurl.com/4xlhz68
author: Mark D.

description: This review is explicitly for their breakfast service.  When I thought a breakfast sandwich experience couldn't get any worse.  I asked for a breakfast sandwich on wheat toast.  They have wheat, great!  Except every veggie costs .45 to add on top of a not cheap 4.45 base "sandwich" price.  Avocado?  1.00.  And the lady essentially put 4 pen-thin slices on my egg.  I could barely see the green.  Can you put tomato on that?  "What tomato?  On a breakfast  sandwich?"  "Yes, tomato."  She had to get clearance from her manager to put 1.5 slices of tomato without charging me another .45 cents.  I didn't dare ask for lettuce.  "Mustard, Mayo Please" ?  Her reply:  "You can do it yourself."  All for a grand total of 7.40.  And they call it a sandwich.
author: Chris S.

description:
Great salad! Awesome macaroni and cheese and a good price considering it's in the Financial district! 

Long line on weekdays at lunch time.
author: Aimee E.

description: Went to this place to grab a salad with my girl Charlee... the line moved quickly but the service SUCKED. The server rushed me (i had never been here before so I wasnt sure how the create your own salad works) didn't explain anything to me then told me they didn't have Avocado when I saw it in my face. I wish i could give this place 4 thumbs down. My mixed greens were the same as anywhere else the tuna is salty as hell and my little ass salad cost 8.00 dollars. So not worth it. Save your money go somewhere else
author: A. C.

description:
I have been coming to Focaccia for 7 years and thought it was about time I wrote a review.   I used to go to the one near Embarcadero 3.  This one is better due to the layout, but they both have the same great food.   

The ingredients are so fresh.  I usually get their small salads which are huge.  The prices have inched up over the years, but they are still cheaper than Mixt Greens and some of the other salad places around. 

The only thing that is a pain about the place is the lines, but they move fast and I will put up with them for a good salad.  it is a bit easier to deal with the lines in this location as they have more space.  At the Embarcadero location the different lines snake every which way and it is hard to deal with the chaos on a lunch break.
author: J D.

description:
I went in today. How the f*kc do you mess up a toasted bagel with cream cheese? The guy they have working the counter since Marina left truely SUCKS!!!!  The other guy, Juan, i think is his name, continues to give first class service and gets orders right. Now the bagel guy, I ordered a toasted bagel, he puts it in the toaster, and he FORGETS about my order. I tell him 2x thats my bagel yet he thinks its for someone waiting on their eggs to be cooked..HEEEELLLLOOOOOO, simple, toast the bagel, and smear, and WRAP IT UP.  NOPE...by the time the bagel guy figures out that I've been telling him, thats my order, he adds teh smear, he wraps and tags the ticket to it. Needless to say my bagel is cold and i have to NUKE it when i get to the office. 

This isnt the first time, ive given theis guy several chances. He tends to forget what you ordered a minute ago. When he first replaced Marina, he was making the omlettes and he too f*kc up my order when i told him less than a minute that i wanted egg whites yet he gave me the yellows. I told him when he poured the egg onto the skillet and he apologized and offered to cook the egg white. I said No, b/c ur wasting food and you probably wont feed the homeless guy sleeping on the sidewalk in front of the store. 

Anyway, conclusion, this bagel guy CANNOT MULTI-TASK OR EVEN service food corerctly. 

I paid $2.45 for a cold ass bagel. Come to think of it, the toaster was probably broke, because it doesnt even taste like a cold ass toasted bagel. Funny how whenever you need a manager they are never around either.

Breakfast here continues to suck. i might as well walk across the street to Lee's, at least I know I can get a toasted bagel done the right away. 

BRING BACK MARINA!!!!
author: Gwen K.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE! 

The only downfall is perhaps that they aren't open in the late afternoon. I have only had their salads and their sandwiches. Both are amazing every time. 

The lines seem daunting pretty much any time you walk in, but they move SUPER quickly. The prices are amazing for the financial district or pretty much anywhere in the city. A small salad is enough to fill you up and it comes with three toppings. A large salad is $7.50 (I believe) but there's rarely a reason to get one so large because you get free focaccia bread with it.

The checkers are always super quick (which also means they aren't talkative really at all... but honestly I'd rather get to eating my delectable lunch anyways). 

The do have an outdoor eating area and you can also access it from 1st street which drops you right off at the end of the salad line. :) Yummm
author: Cassie W.

description: The lines are ridiculous. Salads are on the pricey side but total perfection especially when you're patient enough to stand in the lines (which get increasingly better once 1:30 rolls around). However, I'm down with the tuna sandwich. It has a little bit of a kick to it and it always fresh and yums. Sure, it's expensive, but what isn't around here?
author: Natasha P.

description: If you are a fan of sandwiches you should stop by. In just a few minutes, you'll get your signature sandwich ready and with a lot of stuff inside. Try the olives mayo spread with salmon and avocado!
author: Filippo D.

description:
Okay i have been here only every day this week :D:D and i already love this place :):)

They have a wide selection of toppings and the people making the salad r always so sweet and cheerful.

The spicy chicken is by far my fav meat in the salad...

The fact that they use a clean bowl for every person is certainly impressive :)  extra star for that.. Plus the small order of salad is pretty filling and keeps you full till dinner time.

I definitely recommend this place!!!!
author: Monica M.

description: Quick, easy and healthy option for lunch downtown. Prices are a little inflated, but probably in line with everything else in the financial district.  Everything is fresh, the staff is pleasant.
author: Rachel H.

description:
If you get a salad, a good salad maker is like playing roulette.  Lately, its been missing many more times than hitting.  Newbie salad makers, and this time took the cake.  I turned my head for a moment, and supposedly the salad maker put the dressing in there.  When I turned my head back, I asked if she did, and the reply was if I wanted more dressing.  I said "No, as long as it was medium".  I get back to work, and proceed eating the salad. There was NO dressing in there at all!!!

Fastfoward: since that experience, most of my experiences there have been good
author: Tim w.

description:
HEY GUYS.

I've discovered the perfect sandwich. And it is at Foccacia. I will be generous and share my wealth of knowledge: foccacia bread, smoked turkey, gouda cheese, pesto mayo and vinaigrette spread, lettuce, tomato, roasted red peppers. Toasted. You are welcome.

In all seriousness, the sandwiches here are delicious. You can choose from a lineup of serious quality meats and cheeses, and the sandwich-maker guys often suggest toppings or spreads that would pair well with what you've selected. At $7.95 a pop, it's a bit expensive for me to go every day - but I treat myself occasionally and I never, ever regret it. 

Most of the time I come here after 12:30 and while there is sometimes a line, it usually moves quickly - I'd say I'm always in and out in 15-20 minutes, max, which is not bad for a FiDi lunch. Never tried the salad line or the hot foods, so I can't say much about those.
author: Laurel K.

description:
Quarter chicken, steamed veggie and brown rice. $8.95
Awesome. Fast.
Looks like salad was very long, but I hear it moves quickly and it's good.
Plan to try the salads.
author: Mike C.

description: Salads are great. Breakfast sandwiches and rolls are killer. They get you with their pricing though. Everything is an easy $10
author: Ryan C.

description: My favorite and freshest salad spot in the financial district. Beware, long lines if you go during the lunch rush. Actually the salad bar always has a line but it moves fast! These workers are awesome and so attentive. I always order my own salad with includes spinach/arugula salad mix, topped with marinated tofu, beets and red peppers or edamame. Sometimes I add in their lemon chicken with light balsamic dressing. Their spicy chicken is also to die for and I occasionally order their mac n cheese from the hot food area. Great lunch spot on the go with fresh, tasty ingredients!
author: Jennifer D.

description:
With the City being so cloud and a bit chilly, a co-worker and I thought it would be good to grab something warm. She had been here many a times but the name escaped her, so we just walked to First Street since she remembered that much. Focaccia she exclaimed! There was hardly a line for the hot bar, which is what we were going for, and they had brisket!!! :] I was so happy they had brisket, mashed potatoes, and mac n cheese; seriously Christmas in my mouth! And only $10.25?! Cleary need to revisit this place in the near future. It's a twofer for me; lunch and dinner, or lunch the next day!! 

You HAVE to go here!! They have salads and sandwiches as well but they had a line even at 11:30am!!!
author: Constance D.

description:
It hurts a little to do it, but I'm afraid this is a two star establishment. 

Is the food good? Yes, most of the time, when they have it, and the server gets it right. 

Is the facility beautiful? Yes, when cigarette smoke from the courtyard isn't blowing through the restaurant.

...

Gripes: 

-The prices are way too high. $8+ for a croissant and OJ? Damn! 
-They frequently do not have the food as advertised
-The employees need more training

Me: Can I have an egg, cheese, tomato wrap? 
Them: yes
Me: thanks
...
Them: did you want cheese?
Me: yes
Them: we only have tomato wrap
Me: uhh.. ciabata then
Them: foccacia?
Me: sure, whatever...
Them: do you want cheese?
Me: Yes!
Them: $35 please.
author: Dylan ..

description:
I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place yet!  I work nearby, and this has become my default work lunch option.  It's quite pricey but is worth the splurge.  The long lines at noon can be daunting, and they don't do custom orders early in the day... it's taken me a while to find the best time to arrive to avoid the lines (around 11:15-11:30).  

If you're in a hurry (or arriving early), they have a large selection of pre-made salads. I've tried these a while, and they're good, but I really prefer to have a salad made to order.  The ingredient options for the made-to-order salads are exhaustive.  I have trouble limiting myself to 3 or 4 items (fortunately they rarely charge you for extra veggie toppings).  I love that they use clean utensils and bowls for each salad -- really nice for those of us with food allergies or vegans who don't want meat ''essence'' mixed in with their veggies.   

The hot food counter has some really good choices.  Every day they have rotisserie chicken, with the option of sides. The chicken is really moist and flavorful.  The sides are a little lackluster, but the chicken is so filling that I usually opt to skip their side dishes. The other entree selections vary from day to day.  

I've not tried breakfast yet, aside from the pre-made yogurt and fruit cups which were good, albeit pretty spendy.  They also have a good selection of beverages.

A lot has been said about the employees being surly. I haven't experienced that.  They can be a little brisk when it is really busy, but I've never felt they were unfriendly or impolite.

My only regret about this place is that it is SO crowded after 11:30 each day, and that I end up spending $10 each time I go in.
author: Heidi M.

description:
I can't argue with the fresh quality of ingredients and for financial district, the price is not too bad.  A little high but still doable.  What bugs me about this place is the staff are always grumpy.  You get a fake friendly attitude.  I realize these folks are making minimum wage or not much better and I know how tough that is.  I'm not a difficult customer.  I ask simple questions and no matter how many times i come here, whoever it is, I get the fake friendly grumpy tude.

As an example, I asked if I could get chicken on my salad.  The guy mumbled.   I had to ask again.  I was told no.  But it's right there, I can see it.  Finally, after more back and forth I realize "chicken" is not available but "spicy chicken" is.  Was that so hard to explain?  Could this dumbass not have told me that right away?

Just this morning I asked if they take "ATM"  My mistake.  I should have said do you take debit.  It's 8AM give me a break.  The cashier fumbles with the device, swipes my card a few times and hands it back.  "It doesn't work"

So you get what you pay for as far as food quality but the staff are not the sharpest knives in the drawer
author: Jake S.

description:
Went there around 10am to grab a sandwich before heading to the airport. The guys were not ready (ok, I understand it's still early). Finally, someone came to take the order. He asked, "What kind of spreads?" I said "everything but mayo." Then he said "what? you are telling me you want pesto, olive, etc?" Then he gave me a dirty look. WTF, can you be nicer and just tell me pick one? I walked out without a sandwich. :(

Never going back.
author: Grace M.

description: I was never much of a salad fan until my co-worker introduced me to Foccacia. Since then, I've become addicted and actually crave their salad. I always get the small mixed green and arugula with olives, cucumber, tomatoes, plain chicken, salt, pepper and medium serving of their balsamic vinaigrette. It is sooooo savory deliSHEESH! The line gets long so make sure you come in no later than 11am otherwise expect to wait in line.  I wish they would share their balsamic vinaigrette recipe so i can try to make it during work from home days. The place is very clean and utensils are individually wrapped.
author: Kristine A.

description: An affordable and healthy lunch spot. My colleagues and I frequent this place weekly. A salad with three toppings and protein is roughly $8. Queues can be lengthy during lunch time peak hour (roughly 15 minutes wait time).
author: Amy M.

description:
A simple straightforward sandwich place, served on focaccia! (Or other bread of your choice).

I got the salami and swiss with dijon, lettuce, onions and tomatoes on a focaccia. I was hoping for the traditional, semi-oily rectangular cut focaccia, but they go fancy and have circular focaccia for their sandwiches. I think it should be a choice, I was hoping for more of a selection of focaccia, like caramelized onion or rosemary. So its only the plainer side, but I still enjoyed my toasted sandwich. 

The place is clean and pretty efficient. I think they could do without the huge open floor plan. Just have a cash register at the end of each station and seating inside for people. In SF where the weather is pretty temperamental, its sometimes nice to have a place to sit indoors. 

The guy behind the sandwich counter could be a little nicer too. He's pretty curt. A quick lesson from the Specialtys folks should fix that.
author: Analisa S.

description:
I am not sure when I started coming here to get my food for lunch.  I am also not sure why I have all of a sudden stopped going to other places for lunch.  This I know... I am more predictable than the schedule for Muni.  

So you ask ...uhmm so is it that good?  My answer is... you be the judge.  All I know is  I find myself coming here every day and stand approximately 10-15 minutes in line to get salad.  First of all,  I never liked salad, and all my life I only ate salad in moderation , if at all. Secondly, I hate standing in line, that's why I get my morning coffee in 7-11 instead of Starbucks and Peet's, both of which are closer.

It's also easy to get a consensus among my co-workers if I suggest we go to Focaccia for lunch.  On the other hand, if someone suggests another place,  that person will find himself/herself walking by his/her lonesome.    

The price for  the not so small salad can't be beat.  5.25 and you have a choice of greens plus 3 toppings and they toss it for you.  Plus you get the free focaccia bread.   Believe me, you will  have a hard time finishing their small salad.  'Coz they "pack" it like she's hot!

The sandwich is awesome, as well!  If I were not on a diet (which is not really obvious if you see me),  I would actually get the sandwich more often.  If I may suggest... get their prosciutto with caper mayo,   lettuce, tomato, onions and brie cheese,  over toasted wheat focaccia!   

I will say no more, lest you start coming here for lunch and add to the line.

*Oh yeah, if you decide to come here after reading this,  the best time is like after 1:30 *wink, wink*
author: Buck Z.

description:
Great spot for pick-up lunch in SF's Financial District!  Honestly I am sad to be no longer be frequently working from our SF office, partially due to this new option in the neighborhood. 

 Opened last week and everything's brand spanking new, clean, sleek. Gorgeous salads and sandwiches.  Staff still seems to be getting trained so no robot like efficiency yet (am sure it will come!) and small, packed salads for under $6.  

I had baby spinach with beets, carmelized pears, and goat cheese - so good.  Free bread (focaccia, natch) was also terrific.  Also got a chocolate chip cookie, which looked like Specialty's, but didn't taste as good, so I'll skip that next time.  Because I am going again today, while I can!  Salads this good in NYC are closer to $10, so it's like I'm saving money!
author: Jaimie M.

description: This is my closest coffee and sandwich spot. Quality is decent, and price is very reasonable.
author: Mike P.

description:
I've been holding off from coming here because I read some reviews saying people have found bugs in their salads. But a coworker always said good things about this place. Good salads and fair prices. 
Actually I came here before just to get the foaccia bread to eat with my pasta. Well came here another time with a friends so she could order an omlette. We weren't much of a fan for the omlette. 
So today I decided to give it a go. I got in line for a salad. Surprisingly the line wasn't long at all (ever time I walk by the place is packed). I got romaine hearts,  sprouts, cucumbers, cherry tomatoes, ranch dressing and black pepper. Then someone mixes ot all together and you get bread to go with your salad. My salad was so good and so was the bread. 
Service was efficient and friendly. The place was clean. I will definitely come back here again for a salad. Forget mixt greens it's all about the hype and too expensive. If you want a good quality salad I suggest coming here. You'll be pleased.
author: Jeanie Ann D.

description: The breakfast options are great! I order the build your own scramble so I can pack it full of veggies. If you see a line do not fear the guys cooking the breakfast are efficient, very nice and fast! Salsa is off the hook! Only thing that would make this place better is if the ingredients were organic.
author: M H.

description:
Focaccia has become my go-to sando place this June-uary. The biggest reason is that it's on my block and I hate drudging through the rain, but I've come here on quite a few sunny days too.

I can't comment on the popular salad bar but with sandwhiches you have two choices: cold pre-made or toasted custom order. I always go for the custom when the line is reasonable, but by then they're also often out of the most popular bread and meat options. Still, a freshly toasted sandwhich is worth the effort and the wait. That being said - the pre-made sandos are great and taste very fresh.

As you'd expect from their name the bread is the star (whole wheat is my fave), but the meats and spreads are also of top quality. The only real downside is there are few creative choices to pick from, especially for a high-end SF eatery.
author: Max G.

description:
There are a few places to get good salads around this part of SOMA--Harvest & Rowe, Mixt Greens, etc. But, this is my favorite by far. 

$5 and change for a small but really filling salad with four toppings, dressing and foccacia? Yeah, that works. I can't think of a more fresh, better value in the area.
author: Paul C.

description:
I come here for lunch sometimes and I have to say that you get a pretty good bang for your buck. 

I've never been to the salad bar, but I go to the... "hot bar"? But they offer you a choice of getting 1/4 or 1/2 a chicken (or their meat or fish of the day) and 2 sides (mashed potatoes, mac n cheese, veggies, rice, beets, and curry) for about $9. 

HOWEVER, I got the tilapia with arugala salad, but then the salad was INCREDIBLY SALTY. Like, REALLY SALTY. I think it's the olives and capers they put in it, so bad idea. 

Oh and the focaccia bread is really tasty. Mmmmmm
author: Dustin H.

description: Come here for the salads!  Portions are large (they jam pack the container with greens), lots of topping options, and reasonable prices.  Comes with focaccia - which is a little oily, but hey, it's better that way!  Line can be super duper long around lunch, but they move fairly quickly.  They also do lunch box catering too.
author: Cin S.

description: The salads here are solid. At first, I was a little disappointed because the salad ingredient options don't include all of my favorites (or some of the seasonal items that Mixt Greens has), but the salads here are tasty nonetheless and for a small salad, it's a tad cheaper that Mixt Greens.
author: Musetta S.

description:
I ventured to the other side of the bakery where they have a pretty cool fill-in-the-blank bar. What would you like? They have an oatmeal bar (would you like brown sugar, raisins, or fruit with that?), breakfast sandwich bar (eggs? cheese? choice of filling here_____, focaccia/bagel/ciabatta/ or roll...)...bagel bar (regular or flavored cream cheese..? etc. etc.)

Like a breakfast buffet line smack dab in the middle of downtown.

What FUN.
author: Nicha K.

description:
Oh Focaccia, if only you were actually good, instead of simply across the atrium from my building. However, you are not. 

No longer will I endure your lines for black avocado, canned vegetables, mushy fruit and too much salad dressing. 

Your bread towers will no longer tempt me into oily disappointment. 

Oh, and I do not appreciate being checked at the door for stealing your mediocre lunch offerings.
author: Erin K.

description: Very Poor customer service !!! ....Stay away their food cause food poisoning as well !!!.
author: Chidambaram E.

description:
I sometimes go here for some fresh made salads because they are right near my office. Usually there is a long line at lunch hour which is normal, but once you are at the front of the line, you have to scream your order at employees who don't speak English well, which makes for an awkward experience. Not too big a deal but I can go down the street to Portico and get much better customer service with no misunderstood words or raised voices needed.
Today, I went in to get a salad, and I didn't realize how large the large salads are. I thought I was ordering a small salad. No big deal, right? Wrong. The customer service brunette questioned me in a condescending tone when I asked to just get this salad put in a small container. She said, "well you knew the size when you ordered, so you have to pay for it." I told her that I haven't been here in a while and didn't realize how large the large salads were, and I just want to get this large transferred into a small. I hadn't planned on paying $13, I was thinking more $8.75. Usually in this case, where the "customer is always right", the service gal would have said "no problem, let me put this into a small for you." Not this lady. She had this super condescending tone, and refused to give me a small salad, saying she doesn't want to "throw the food away." I should have put the salad down right there, and walked out. But I paid for my salad and left. I will never go back. I don't want to see that service lady. I can still hear her condescending and rude tone of voice. If the customer makes a one time mistake in their order, you are supposed to accomodate. You just lost a customer. Shame on your customer service lady!
author: Dave M.

description: This is a review for their sandwiches. I go there once in a while, usually after I've forgotten how disappointing the last time was. Today, the sandwich maker was rude, and the sandwich especially crappy. I got the white baguette with ham, cheese and avocado. The bread tasted like something sitting in the supermarket for a few days. The avocado was almost non-existent despite charging extra for it. The price of $10 was definitely not worth it. With all the other sandwich places in the area, I will not be returning again.
author: Kate N.

description: Used to like it...until I got really bad food poisoning from the smoked salmon salad.
author: Grant C.

description:
Been to both the locations near me, and it's clear -- this place is super cute, with very different but both very beautiful locations (this location in particular is so impressive with it's enormously high ceilings and marble all over), but it's just not my cup of tea.

The muffins look so beautiful, wrapped in paper, and the coffee cake also looked delicious, but on both separate occasions, these pastries have shown themselves to be just... cooked in the oven a few minutes past my liking.

The muffin was so crunchy on top that it almost hurt the roof of my mouth, and the coffee cake (coffee cake!!) was the same way.  The muffin was also very hearty and branny tasting.

To each his or her own -- if you like very crispy/well-cooked pastries, this is your spot.  If you do not... admire from afar.
author: David W.

description: I love coming here for a quick to-go lunch when I'm working downtown. I usually get a small custom salad ($5.95 and it's the perfect size for me to be full). You can pick your own toppings and dressing and they'll mix it for you on the spot. Their hot meals and sandwiches are delicious as well. The sandwiches take a little longer if you want them to be toasted, but I'll recommend the pesto mayo sauce with ham. It gets quite crowded during peak lunchtime hours (11:30AM - 1:00PM), but they're very efficient so you don't have to wait that long. Sadly they don't have a seating area.
author: Leslie C.

description:
The hot food here was really good.  Damn their pork loin and mac and cheese really hit the spot.  I highly recommend trying those items.

Not sure if this place gets super packed because I went on a Friday at 12:45 PM, probably after the lunch rush dies down a bit.

There are seats outside in the open plaza where the back entrance is.  My lunch companions really seemed to enjoy their salads and sandwiches!  I'm definitely going to go again.
author: Anna T.

description:
I like this place.  The line was kinda long during peak hours, but it moved pretty fast.  People were very efficient there.  

Basically there are three lines, one for the sandwiches, one for the salads and one for the hot food.  

Today, I got the Turkey sandwich.  Basically you build your own sandwich there.  You can choose  the type of bread, cheese, dressing, 3 types of veggies and meat.  If you want to add on additional item, there will be extra charge.  I got the whole sandwich and it cost $7.25.  Half Sandwich cost $4.25.

The sandwich was huge and tasted very good.  All ingredients were so fresh.  I think the price was pretty reasonable in Financial District. 

After you pay for your food, remember to get a free foccacia bread.  The bread was so good!  Don't Forget!!

One star deducted because they don't have seats there.  You need to bring your food back to the office or neither find seats outside.
author: Liza T.

description:
People from work are obsessed with this place and it's O.K. but I much prefer Specialties. Maybe it's something about being able to completely customize your meal, but the lines are always long and even if you go when the line is pretty short they take forever making your food. 

Tons of selection though. Fresh food, fresh sandwiches and salads. I got the hot items once and it wasn't that good. Stick with the salad or sandwiches. Lots of quick to-go items so that's convenient.
author: christine c.

description:
I was excited to see a new lunch option for me!

Pretty good sandwiches here...and they have fresh fruit..today i had a whole entire bown of just strawberries and blueberries....totally yummy!

The staff are friendly and courteous.

Minus one stars because the place is total chaos...it's sort of like cafeteria style..but the employee's perpare the food fresh...but while you are wating it feels like you are at the NYC stock exchange..

I bet this place rocks when there is no line.

Anyway..as i write this i am chowing on my strawberries and blueberries...my antioxidant power lunch!
author: Ripley B.

description:
I am a big fan of Focaccia and have been eating their sandwich for years now. The food feels really fresh and the prices are extremely reasonable. I usually get their sandwiches, you can fully customized the sandwich (bread, meat, cheese an toppings) try their wheat focaccia with fresh turkey you won't be disappointed.

They have great salads and fresh hot entrees. good selection of fruits, yogurt and granola. The lines can be long between 12-1 so come early or late
author: Subhash J.

description: Great place for a salad, but the untrustworthiness of the people who work/manage the place is a bit annoying. The salad line does take a while during lunch hours but their salads are good and decently priced as long as you don't order any meat. The bread that comes w/ the salads are delicious!
author: Leily P.

description:
3.5 stars! 

This is a great place in the FiDi for lunch. It has different stations with the options of hot entrees, salads, sandwiches, soup, and pastries. My coworkers and I came on a Friday afternoon around 12:30ish and the place was surprisingly not too packed. We waited for about 5-10 minutes before it was our turn to order our salads. I like the fact that you can totally customize your salad, with your choice of size, greens, toppings, meats, and dressing. I would recommend the small salad because the large is pretty big and filling. Each salad comes with 3 toppings, but I think they are a bit stingy with the toppings. Most of the time, I felt like I was just eating the greens... I also ordered the spicy chicken with my salad, but it was kind of dry. Next time, I will probably just stick with veggies. The lady who made my salad accidentally gave me the large size instead of the small, and I didn't notice until after I paid.. so I pretty much just had enough appetite to eat half of it, leaving the other half to go to waste. 

The best part of the meal was the FOCACCIA BREAD (of course). It was freshly baked, soft, and flavorful. It was a bit oily though, but I could eat that ALL DAY EVERY DAY!! I would come back just for the bread.... :)
author: Michelle L.

description: February 25, 2012 - found a grasshopper/cricket in my sandwich that was cut in half but still moving.  Unfortunately I ate part of the sandwich
author: C M.

description: This is my current favorite salad/lunch place. Even during lunch traffic the line always goes quickly, and the salads are always a decent price and packed full of everything I ask for. I've been there a bunch of times and have so far never had the problem of having too much plain lettuce. Occasionally their interpretation of "light" dressing is actually "medium", but that hasn't been a problem. I usually get a small salad which is the perfect size because the salad is packed so tightly!
author: Katie V.

description: My office got catering from here and it was nice cheese, fruit, veggie and bread platters. The focaccia itself--delicious. I have been to their store once and it was around 1:40 pm and they were out of a lot of the hot food--kind of a bummer.
author: Julia D.

description:
Focaccia is my go-to lunch place whenever I'm too busy to think about what I want to eat. Why? Because everything there is good. It's decently priced, too. For $7-8 you get an extremely nutritious and filling lunch and a piece of delicious bread to go. If you see that huge line, don't be fooled, just grab an already made salad or sandwich from the back fridge and be in and out in less than 5 minutes. 

Also I recently tried their hot meal takeout selections, I got baked chicken, veggies, and mashed potatoes and it was heavenly. Seriously you just can't go wrong here.
author: Martina M.

description: The location at the Embarcadero is much better. Here, the pastries are fine, but the general theme of their lunch options is "dry." Dry meats, dry veggies (not to mention undercooked)....the only "wet" option is the mac-and-cheese, meaning it sits in a pool of liquid butter! To top it off, portions are stingy and the service sucks. I'm only coming back for a muffin if I'm ever in the mood.
author: Nicole L.

description: I love the coffee here! I stop in about 3 days a week for their yummy pumpkin muffin and a cup of the Bizzari Blend (sp? Whatever their medium roast is...). Never tried anything from their hot menu, but their pastries are great. Good price and quick and friendly service.  Nice if you're in the mood for something other than Starbucks for the 100th time.
author: Kelly E.

description: Long lines are annoying at lunch and deter me on most days. The pre made foods are high quality and they have a great selection of teas and soda for a pick me up in the afternoon. Calorie conscious must use restraint on the free and tempting focaccia! Their breakfasts are great too if your willing to wait for 10 minutes in the morning.
author: Jill R.

description:
I love Focaccia and can eat here everyday. The salads I order usually come out around $7.20 and the size is just perfect. I tend to mix it up, but it's usually mixed greens, lime chicken, avocado, goat/feta, tomatoes, beans, and lime or balsamic vinaigrette. You must ask for Monica or Mayra, they are super sweet.

 I also enjoy eating the 1/4 chicken breast with two optional sides for $6.20-$7. I recommend the chicken picata with potatoes and mac and cheese for $9.17. Also, try to go a little before 12pm and after 1pm to beat the lines.
author: Stephanie M.

description: Good lunch options for the price.  Great options and great price.  I prefer it to mixt greens (which is overpriced and a huge line out the door).  They have 2 sizes so you can get the right size you would like to eat.
author: Sheetal P.

description:
I'm SO happy this place FINALLY opened and better, yet, its right across the street from my work!!! 

The pumpkin muffin is GREAT.. beat my fave zucchini walnut muffin at starbucks and my pumpkin bread at tully's.. Prices can be a little higher but you get great quality FRESH food that is delicious and tasty and hits the spot!

Kat M. and Melanie C. made me try the famed capered mayo-smoked salmon combo.. omg how did I survive without this!? I skip the cucumber and just do lettuce, tomato, cheese and pickles. YUM! Sure not everyone is THAT friendly there but my sandwich people and cashier ppl are always nice to me. PLUS its the only place I can get a sandwich early in the morning before 10am.
author: Diana R.

description: Opened this week in my building.  Nice setup for sandwiches and salads.  I got the ham/swiss on the regular focaccia bread not-toasted.  It was just okay, the bread was very soft and good.  I may try another sandwich toasted.  $6.95 which isn't bad, I'd choose this over Specialty's.  The salads looked good.  Nice to have it on the first floor of my building.
author: Josh L.

description: I come here at least once a week and always get the small salad which is more than enough food for one person. For $7.50 downtown, you definitely get a bang for your buck. Also, all the servers are so friendly and sweet (plus sometimes the guy on sandwiches will sing-along-the-eighties) and seem pretty happy. The only criticism is that the chicken is a little dry, but whatever, the greens are consistently fresh and every other fixing is top notch.
author: Mi M.

description: I understand you guys have some security issues but harassing your customers for a receipt as they leave is pretty tacky and bad use of your time/money.  What about maybe a "paid" sticker if the environmentally conscious customer decides not to take a to-go bag or maybe rearrange your checkout so that customers pay as soon as they get their orders?  Good place for a quick lunch but unless the harassment stops, it doubt I'll be going back.  I hope you solve your security issues but don't do it as the cost of losing customers.
author: Paul G.

description: GRASSHOPPER IN SALAD - and it was STILL ALIVE trying to escape the grasps off the salad dressing it was swimming in!!
author: Justin C.

description: This place usually has a line almost out the door for the amazing salads.  As a person with food allergies I have never had a problem with cross contamination.  Each server is careful with not pounding utensils over other items, they mix in a fresh bowl, with a clean set of tongs and gloves.  Many, many ingredients to choose from to create your own salad.  They also have delicious roast chicken and other hot meals to choose from, and there is hardly a line for the hot meals or sandwich counter.  Another option for grab and go deliciousness in the FiDi.
author: Shantelle B.

description:
Wanted to give a yelp-out to this fantastic somewhat newcomer to the SOMA side of FiDi. Really love my toasted tuna salad on whole wheat focaccia with provolone, balsamic vinaigrette, lettuce and red onion (sorry about that last one 1pm meeting mates). Big enough to split with a lucky someone.

Lots of other good suggestions I see here from other yelper's and one day I'll venture out... or maybe not. Will be hard to steer away from one of my favorite go-to sandwiches in the hood.
author: Becky S.

description: I didn't have much time before a meeting nearby, so I grabbed a pre-made tuna sandwich and water.  The lines to order food looked crazy, but I was in and out in a couple of minutes.  The tuna was good, not too much mayo.
author: Seong P.

description: Love their food! We've gotten their cheese plates at work, which were good but boy, oh boy their lunch is great. They have two lines for sandwiches/salads which are both make-your-own styled. The add-on options for each are incredible and while the lines may appear long on most days, they move relatively fast.
author: Stephanie F.

description: I used to be a frequent visitor of Focaccia mostly because their rotisserie chicken and side selections was usually fast, easy, and Paleo.  I stick to strictly to their hot food since that sandwich and salad line is ABSOLUTELY ridiculous. In saying that, I've probably just given away a big secret of mine.  Anyway, I stopped coming here because their pork loin had been overcooked, and their chicken was also sort of dry.  Their sides were usually too much, and while I'd be full after a meal, it was always just mediocre.  I came back to Focaccia today for lunch after taking about a 5 month hiatus, and I'm pleased to say that I think they've improved their chicken.  I had their 1/2 chicken with two sides today (double serving of steamed vegetables).  For about $10, I was sufficiently surprised with the amount of food I was given.  Their chicken was cooked perfectly, and that skin they had on it was absolutely incredible.  It may have been a little bit on the salty side, but it went well with those steamed vegetables that lacked some flavor.  In any case, I don't think I'll be back to make Focaccia a habit again, but it was certainly a good meal to have every once in awhile.
author: Lisa I.

description: I had an awesome pulled pork sandwich here the other week. It was their daily special. Juicy, sweet and flavorful. Served on a wheat foccacia bun? Classic winner!
author: Teresa G.

description: I LOVE this place! So much in fact, that I literally go here every day for lunch. Their salads are amazing, and the customer service is always outstanding! Before I discovered Focaccia, I used to go to Mixt Greens everyday (Umm... $12.00 salads? No thanks!). At Focaccia, I get just as much food (with the small salad order) and it's nearly 1/2 the price. LOVE IT!
author: Mindy G.

description:
The only gripe with this place -  certain salad handlers pick up different ingredients (including tuna salad, slimy fish and shrimp items & soft cheeses) with their gloved hands instead of using tongs.  So the ingredients sometimes get mixed up, because their gloves can get really grimy.  

Like today when the woman was cleaning all the dressing bottles with a towel, then she proceeded to handle pick up all my salad ingredients with the same gloves!  As in she did not use the tongs to pick up the food, she used her grimy-gloved hands!  I didn't get any dressing for my salad, but I certainly tasted all the different dressings she handled when I ate it. 

Otherwise, I agree - the prices are reasonable, the cashiers in particular are very pleasant and the ingredients are generally quite fresh.  My same salad at Mixd Greens (where the food handling is much more sanitary) costs almost 2x as much as what I pay at Focaccia.

I'm a late-luncher, so the lines are not bad when I go around 1:30-2pm.   I'm usually in and out of there within 5-10 minutes.
author: CuNyc S.

description: After having Mixt Greens for a while, discovering this place was a great step up! I usually get a salad for lunch, and was happy to find that this place has a greater selection of ingredients. I really like how they also have packaged fruit (there's also a small farmer's market right next door a couple of times each week). Overall, the price is decent for being in fidi. Beware of long lines during peak lunch hours though!
author: Rose Y.

description: John, the friendly sandwich guy, definitely does not discriminate on my 9:30 am lunch hour! He's awesome --Makes my sandwich perfectly every time and now, all I do is show up and he knows exactly what to make me. =) Talk about efficiency and great customer service! I've been there on three occasions when he wasn't present and was denied my sandwich because of the early hour. Thank you, John, and thank you Focaccia for great fresh food and for opening across the street from my job! =)
author: Kat M.

description: I typically get breakfast here. Good oatmeal and bagels. I hear the breakfast burritos are tasty and large in size. My favorite is an egg white omelet with chicken apple sausage,  cheese and toast. Very consistent but sometimes there is a wait. Love the hazelnut coffee. I tried the blueberry scone a few weeks ago and fell in love. Eating them twice a week so far. I used to like the blueberry scone at Starbucks but this scone now takes its place.
author: Christina C.

description: I love Focaccia! I work in the building and get the same large spinach salad about 3 times a week. The produce is fresh! (I come in the morning for breakfast and see them prepping all of the veggies etc). The line can get crazy just before noon till after 1pm, so if you come in at 11:30 on a weekday..your set! The service is great, everyone is friendly, and the whole wheat Focaccia near the register is fantastic. The only downside is the lunchtime crunch! Get the lemon chicken on top!
author: Dylan B.

description: Since it opened I've found Focaccia to be great for a quick bite around FiDi/Soma at lunch time. The prepared salads are my go-to, mostly because the line to order a custom blend is so long. The prices here are a bit less than other places in the area, the quality is better than most other salad bars, and you get free bread here if so inclined.
author: Lesly S.

description: Trendy upscale joint to grab some lunch. Wide selection of salads, some hot comfort food like rotisserie chicken, meatloaf, and ribs. But my ticket is the sandwich section where u can customize everything from the bread, meat, spread, and cheese. It's a must check out if your in the area.
author: T L.

description: I am a big fan of Focaccia because the food feels really fresh and the prices are extremely reasonable. I always order 1/4 chicken and two sides (usually the mac and cheese and a vegetable to offset the unhealthiness of the M&C) for only $7. The guy at the hot foods section is very sweet and helpful. He always seems to give me big portions too. I have yet to try their sandwiches but have heard they are good too.
author: Jenna Q.

description: This place is in my building and I'd say I go here like 3 days a week if not more. The food's pretty good and the staff is friendly since we're there all the time.
author: Brooke G.

description: First time trying it. Had heard a lot of good things about their healthy salads that come with a delicious piece of focaccia. Lined up for at least 10 minutes.  Turns out they were out of beets, edamame and....... focaccia. Despite this, I'm giving them three stars because it was pretty good and a much better value than Mixt Greens (last time I ate there, I was hungry about 2 hours later). The salad seemed to be comprised of fresh ingredients and the sesame soy dressing was good.
author: Boss H.

description: I've been dying to try this place but was intimidated by some of the reviews that it was going to be a pushy, stressful experience. I think the key is to go early. The salad chefs are awesome and super helpful if you're not sure what toppings go together the best. I got a small spinach w/strawberries, goat cheese and candied walnuts w/honey mustard for around $6, plus a delicious piece of focaccia. The lady at the register was super nice too. Love!!
author: Marie C.

description: I am happy to say the service here have improved so much!!  The ladies are all so nice and personable.  I had the pleasure of meeting Selene today and I sometimes see her on BART.  The line get pretty crazy but surprising moves pretty fast.  The prices are very reasonable for a salad compare to the other places in the area.  Keep up the great work!!!
author: Y O.

description: I just had to update my review...  the last few weeks I have been picking up lunch here from the hot food items because they are awesome!  Everyday they have about 4 options, a couple chicken items, fish of the day and a red meat.  I have now tried two of the fish options sole and tilapia... Slammin!  I also had a chicken and lentil dish that was tasty too.  You get two heaping servings of sides like mac n cheese, mashed potatoes and roasted veggies.  The mac n cheese is to die for, buttery cheesy goodness.  This seciton of the place is usually the least busy which is a plus when you are in a rush.  The only downside is to the pocket book, $9.  This is now on the weekly rotation fo sho!
author: La C.

description:
I went to this large self service place a week ago for the first time.
On my way out a security person dressed in a civilian
said something like "good bye madam" in a tone like "I have been
watching you"
I go to lunch to relax not to get the 3rd degree from a man
who sees everyone as a potential shop lifter.
I wouldn't recommend this outfit to anyone wishing to have 
a pleasant and relaxed experience at lunch time.
this outfit probably spends thousands of dollars to annoy
customers, and trying to save the restaurant a few dollars 
from a possible shoplifter.
the manager tried to justify this kind of behavior on the 
fact that they caught people leaving without paying.
I am sorry they had that experience but consumers should
not be the victims of these security people disrespectful behavior.
I feel very offended and will not go there again.
furthermore, it is bad use of the restaurant dollars and the expense
is passed on to the consumers with increased prices.
author: aline d.

description: A good wholesome sandwich for lunch, Focaccia is the place to go. Lots of choices to choose from and high quality breads. Great food and can get in and out within 15 minutes.
author: Christine A.

description:
I guess I am a dissenter or maybe I just have a different value scale than the majority. I want to like focaccia, the people are nice and there a lots of variety to choose from but alas my rating scale has them slotted down to this level. Let's go through it
Taste: I want to like their hot food bar, the meatloaf, the steak, quarter chicken, etc. it all looks so good standing behind the counter, sadly it gets greasy and tastes salty. Even the veggies are greasy and oily, yuck. Sandwiches, they offer lots of choice, which is great for the variety score, but I find their ratio of meat to bread kind of low. You really got to go double meat to get it to where I like it, then it's a $13 sandwich! Salads are fine and anyone who walks by anytime after noon will tell you that the line is absurdly long.
Variety: tons of options, subs, custom salads, pre-made salads, cookies, and hot entree bar. It's not for lack of options
Value: everything is expensive! As stated above, sandwiches are expensive unless you aren't that hungry. Entrees are expensive and the salads can get expensive.  It's prime location so I get it, according to their own signs, food theft is an issue to maybe the pricing accounts for shrinkage.
Overall: like I said, I want to like focaccia. But in all fairness, create a system to avoid bias and you see where each places rate based on your factors. Sadly this is it...
author: Aldo K.

description: Upscale Subway: good ingredients, but the bread has less flavor and substance than Subway bread. yuck. It ruins the sandwich.
author: Dana D.

description: Came to this place for the first time for lunch yesterday (had a focaccia marinated chicken sandwich with lettuce, tomatoes and cucumbers.)  Ended up sick all evening and all night. Did anyone else experience this yesterday?
author: Allison B.

description:
I work at 525 Market so I end up going to Focaccia once or twice a week. However I never actually get in line for the hot-food items since they are always SOOO long. Not to mention the premade salads are awesome - particularly the Pear & Goat Cheese - so it is hard to justify the wait. It is really convenient that there are two check outs so that you can get in and out if you are just grabbing something.

One of these days I will go early enough to actually get real food because I have heard everything is delicious, if a little pricy.
author: Emmy L.

description: Yay, new lunch place near the office.
